channel.id: Crime and Investigation Network HDTV (CI HD)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: High-end pawnbroker James Constantinou faces rare items that are allegedly from Arctic explorer Ernest Shackleton's expeditions and values some vintage Chanel handbags. He also discovers a problem when he takes assistant Jo out for a terrifying test drive in a client's Porsche.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: High-end pawnbroker James tries to make an £85,000 deal on a modified sports car, while designer handbag expert Claudia heads to Germany to value a large collection of bags owned by a former New York socialite. A female bodybuilder wants to sell jewellery so she can fund her new hobby, and a golf fanatic brings in a case of vintage wine.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer revisit two sets of house-hunters. In North Yorkshire, they catch up with Trudi and Steve who relocated from Edinburgh to be nearer their relatives, and in Luton, Bedfordshire, the experts find out whether community artist Zena has been able to move out of her parents' home and get onto the property ladder.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: John Wilson, the President and Chief Operating Officer of Rollins Incorporated - the parent company of eight pest-control firms including flagship brand Orkin - goes undercover. He poses as a contestant on a reality TV competition who is trying to win money for his own business, and works alongside his employees to make sure the organisation is heading for another century of keeping homes rodent-free.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef travels to New Orleans to visit Zeke's, a much-loved restaurant that has seen standards slip since the original owner died. The new proprietors, husband and wife duo Darryl and Ellen Cortello, focused all the efforts on the financial side of things, so it is up to Gordon to show them that they first need to love food to make any profit.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Wakes Hall Lodges near Colchester is the fourth and final visit of the week, where Neal and Mike are wowed by the five-star self-catering accommodation, complete with hot tubs and lakeside views. The others aren't so sure about the `luxury' breakfast hamper, however, especially as it means cooking their own. An afternoon of dog agility gives manager Marianne Cammack the chance to demonstrate her authority, although over dinner, her domineering conversation causes Jackie to finally snap.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Wrestling promoter Dale Harvey hosts the first dinner party in Derby, where he hopes to impress aspiring thespian Beth Dunmore, business support manager Jo-Anna, mother-of-three Ondine Shardlow, and triathlete David Morris with a wrestling-themed extravaganza featuring large men in tight lycra. However, a fractious royal debate dampens the mood.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Business support manager Jo-Anna hosts the second dinner party in Derby, and hopes to wow her guests with a glitz and glam evening - complete with ball gowns and poetry. However, David is hoping for a more lively night - and his antics do not impress fellow contestant Dale.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: PR whizz Beth Dunmore hosts the third night in Derby, and she hopes to impress her guests with her vaguely Middle Eastern menu. However, she has her work cut out when it comes to the fussy David Morris, whose confidence seems to be growing as the week progresses. Beth has a fan in cruise ship connoisseur Jo-Anna, though, while single mum Ondine Shardlow is disappointed with the level of competition and thinks she has the week in the bag.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Ondine Shardlow hosts the fourth dinner party in Derby, hoping to impress her guests with a flavoursome Greek holiday-inspired menu. However, her carefully planned evening takes a turn for the worse when she manages to insult Dale, and Jo-Anna displays some questionable table manners.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the final day of the dinner party contest in Derby and the turn of triathlete David Morris to serve his offerings. Ondine is not impressed by his small portions, big flavours approach, and is even less satisfied with Jo-Anna's behaviour during the week. The host throws an impromptu work-out class where wrestling promoter Dale Harvey is put through his paces, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer's latest mission takes them to Sussex, where they help to solve two different house-hunting problems. Ashlee Newton has been saving for nine years to buy her first home, and is looking for a period flat near the bars and restaurants of Brighton or Hove. Colin Amery and Robin Balance are getting ready to move in together for the first time, and want to find a property they can renovate from scratch - which means they are paying particular attention to architectural details.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: After 30 years of marriage and a life dedicated to their family, Simon and Mary Loyne feel the time has arrived to focus on themselves. They have sold their Cheshire home and cannot wait to move to Spain's Costa Almeria. Danni Menzies shows them five fabulous properties for their budget of £100,000, but do they go for a townhouse with a man cave Simon really wants or an apartment close to the beach, in Mary's perfect location?.(n)

programme.title: Animal Rescue Live: Supervet Special
programme.desc: Professor Noel Fitzpatrick and Steve Jones host an appeal to rehome all the animals in Newcastle Dog & Cat Shelter, attempting to encourage would-be owners to consider them first over buying a pet. Many more rescue centres across the country are also taking part, while Kate Quilton follows adoptions as they happen in real time.(n)

programme.title: Old People's Home for 4 Year Olds
programme.desc: Ten four year olds are half way through an ambitious six-week experiment, as they share their classroom with 11 pensioners who all follow the same timetable in a nursery near Bristol. Has the energy and activities of the younger group had a measurable impact on the pensioners? Can this ambitious experiment transform the way Britain cares for its increasingly older population?.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the popular quiz as Sean Lock and David O'Doherty compete against Jon Richardson and Natasia Demetriou. John Kearns joins Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: Over the last decade, incidents of violence perpetrated by young men have risen by 22% and this edition examines the stories behind some of these calls and crimes. In Swindon, officers Emily Grigor and Simon Sanghera are called to arrest a man in his early twenties who has ripped off his top in a drunken rage before putting his fist through a wall and his foot through a window in a bar.(n)

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose their favourite from a line-up of potential dates who reveal themselves one body part at a time - in all their naked glory. First up is 22-year-old gym addict Sophie from Surrey, who is desperate to find a man who boasts a little banter. Next up is Dom, a 25-year-old wedding model from Bournemouth. He wants to find the perfect man to waltz him down the aisle and thinks people that can guarantee to do this are confident, daring and adventurous in their outlook.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Benefit Tenants
programme.desc: As council housing numbers fall, private landlords across the nation have been buying up houses. Now, more benefit tenants than ever before are renting privately, and this series, following last year's one-off documentary, charts the work of specialist letting agencies dealing in this section of the property market. Andrew Dyke manages nearly 1,000 clients in Goldthorpe, South Yorkshire. While one tenant has a rat infestation, another texts to apologise for leaving in a hurry. Kicking in the front door, Andrew finds a hastily abandoned cannabis factory. In Leeds, Katie Wiggins tries to evict a troublesome pensioner and her boyfriend, and to avoid emergency hostels, aims to find them somewhere else to live.(n)

programme.title: Real, Fake or Unknown
programme.desc: Trying to prove the authenticity of the internet's most famous clips, including a futuristic head shave, the world's most idiotic selfie and a city in the sky. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: My Online Nightmare
programme.desc: This documentary explores some of the most extraordinary scammers and fraudsters who use the internet to lure and con their victims with terrifying, and sometimes deadly, results. This first episode examines astonishing cases of sex fraud, telling the stories of people who were tricked into thinking that the person they met online were someone completely different.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: In the first of a two-part edition, Gordon Ramsay heads to La Galleria 33 in Boston, Massachusetts, an Italian restaurant run by sisters Rita and Lisa. The pair grew up working at their father's eatery nearby, but when they opened their own business, they couldn't replicate his success, and they now blame their failure on everything from the weather to the tablecloths.(n)

programme.title: The Question Jury
programme.desc: Tension mounts and loyalties are put to the test as two of the jurors go head to head in a battle to win the money.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: James heads to Ibiza to appraise a luxury speedboat worth over £100,000 and a diamond ring, while Lawrence values a piece of boxing memorabilia. Designer handbag expert Claudia must brush up on her history when she is confronted with a rare purse.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: High-end pawnbroker James hopes to sell a Second World War Tiger Moth biplane for £70,000, while two different diamond rings bought for £22,000 give the Prestige Pawnbrokers team a headache. Plus, a lord and lady try to sell some luxury handbags and a guitar signed by members of the Rolling Stones.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Single mother Jo Beck wants to move her family to Derby, despite her children being happily settled in Nottingham. Phil Spencer helps her decide if relocating is the right choice and searches for a suitable home. Also in Derby, Kirstie Allsopp offers advice to outdoor sports enthusiasts Liz and John Fairfield, who are looking for a property with a large garden, storage space for their sporting equipment and no noise from nearby roads.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: President of Moe's Southwest Grill, Paul Damico, goes undercover to check the standards he values are still being met. The company is one of the world's fastest growing restaurant chains with 10,000 employees and Paul wants to look for opportunities to assist his staff in a similar way to how his family were helped by his father's bosses during his childhood.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits three more restaurants he helped that were among the biggest challenges he faced, finding out whether they stayed on the road to recovery or turned back into nightmares. First he meets sisters Rita and Lisa to see if they have continued serving fresh instead of frozen food at Boston's La Galleria 33, before heading to the Olde Hitching Post in Hanson, Massachusetts, to discover whether controlling owner Tom has kept his promise and handed over the reins to his daughter Andrea. Finally, Gordon goes back to the Prohibition gastro pub in Everett, Washington, to catch up with owner Rishi and learn if she has ditched belly-dancing in favour of running her business.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid and to settle some scores. Things are tense from the start as Carole and Michael from Alston House challenge Marie on her comments. Next, Marie from Scotia House wants to set the record straight with allegations of tit-for-tat scoring. The group members proceed to thrash out their differences before the week's winners are revealed.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The competition heads to Manchester, where battling it out for the £1,000 cash prize are part-time DJ Dom, 35-year old barber Danny, trainee barrister Sasha, nurse Katherine and goth Maria. In the first edition, DJ Dom kicks off the week serving up a menu inspired by the 1990s `Madchester' music scene.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Trainee barrister Sasha hosts the second night in Manchester, where she hopes to impress her guests with a Chinese-Pakistani fusion menu. Meanwhile, fellow contestant Maria reveals more about her love of gothic culture, and Danny discusses his soon-to-be-written autobiography.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Nurse Katherine hosts the third dinner party in Manchester, and she opts for a simple menu of a smoked salmon with horseradish cream starter, and a chorizo and chickpea main course. At the table, direct questioning and some extraordinary revelations cause some of the guests to feel uncomfortable.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Barber Danny hosts the fourth night of the competition in Manchester, and decides on an evening of Bulgarian cuisine as a homage to his wife. His party ends with some Bulgarian language lessons that bemuse fellow diners Dom and Maria.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the final night in Manchester and glamorous goth Maria is hoping to wow her guests with her twist on Asian cuisine. Some of the guests are feeling a little uneasy that the host will impart her love of vampire culture upon her menu, but the blood-free dishes even manage to impress daddy's girl Sasha. However, an avant-garde transgender dancer creates a stir, and at one point it seems possible that Maria has bitten off more than she can chew.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer try to solve the problems of first-time buyers in north London. Kirstie tries to end the house-hunting misery of Ify Okoye, who has viewed 90 properties without success. Meanwhile, Phil assists a couple looking to settle down in England after six years abroad - but discovers their ambitions may put their budget under serious strain.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Kent retirees David and Donna Bradley want to relocate permanently to Menorca, so Laura Hamilton shows them five properties for their £300,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: Animal Rescue Live: Supervet Special
programme.desc: Steve Jones, Kate Quilton and Noel Fitzpatrick continue with the week-long appeal to rehome all the animals in Newcastle Dog & Cat Shelter, encouraging would-be owners to consider them first over buying a pet. Many more rescue centres across the country are also taking part, with the team following adoptions as they happen.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two couples hoping to relocate to Surrey. Sonia and Daniel Alderson-Smith have a sizeable budget to find a new property in East Molesey - but have also decided there are only 18 streets on which they will consider living. Meanwhile, Phil offers advice to Maeve and Peter Dunne, who are unsure about which part of the county to move to.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Headteacher Emma arrives in resus having been in a collision with a bus while cycling home from the school she works at. As she is treated, her husband Mick reflects on being informed what had happened. Meanwhile, 33-year-old Josh is treated for severe back pain, and 87-year-old Pamela is examined for a possible blood clot in her leg, and tells the doctors about her childhood in London during the Blitz.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The documentary follows Kirstine and Phil, who have not spent a day apart in four years, but following an emergency during labour the pair find themselves separated. Cameras also focus on independent businesswoman Tyla. While awaiting the arrival of her third child, she starts to reconsider her romantic future. And although Spanish nurses Carlota and Javier epitomise the perfect relationship, the pair realise that labour can be challenging even for the best of partnerships.(n)

programme.title: Princess Diana's `Wicked' Stepmother
programme.desc: An examination of the turbulent relationship between Diana, Princess of Wales and her formidable stepmother Raine Spencer, who rose from humble origins with the help of her larger-than-life mother, the novelist Barbara Cartland, to become a countess and a member of the royal family. Raine was a divisive figure, who was doted on by her husband Johnnie Spencer but loathed by Diana and her siblings. Yet as the princess's marriage collapsed, she reached out to her stepmother for support, marking a change in the women's relationship.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Kelso tries to write a song in a desperate bid to win back Jackie, while Eric turns down a date with Donna to be with his mates - but soon regrets it. Comedy, starring Mila Kunis, Ashton Kutcher and Debra Jo Rupp.(n)

programme.title: Dance Moms
programme.desc: Abby suspends Christi and Chloe indefinitely. Meanwhile, a painful medical condition returns to haunt Nia and Holly.(n)

programme.title: Dance Moms
programme.desc: Melissa finds a way to use Christi and Kelly's bickering to her advantage. Meanwhile, Nia proves determined to perform her duet, despite Abby's attempts to withdraw it.(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Donna discovers a pair of panties in the car and worries Eric may be two-timing her, while Kitty puts Red on a diet. Nostalgic comedy series, starring Laura Prepon, Topher Grace and Debra Jo Rupp.(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Laurie babysits a girl, making Kitty wish she had a baby of her own. Meanwhile, Donna fights with Eric over family values after she finds out he expects her to be a housewife if they have children. Nostalgic comedy series, starring Mila Kunis, Topher Grace and Debra Jo Rupp.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Michael reluctantly agrees to have a prostate examination and learns he will have to undergo further tests. Claire tries to trick Jay into doing her homework, and Kady sends the police on a wild goose chase.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Claire sneakily eats a snack intended for Michael but refuses to own up - so he devises a special punishment to force a confession from the culprit. Unfortunately, it backfires badly and undermines his authority in the household.(n)

programme.title: 8 Simple Rules
programme.desc: Paul insists on having a family get-together in the old treehouse on Halloween - with surprising consequences.(n)

programme.title: 8 Simple Rules
programme.desc: Paul consults a parenting book in a desperate attempt to regain his daughters' love and respect - but the girls find out, and use the discovery to manipulate him into letting them attend a rock concert.(n)

programme.title: Dance Moms
programme.desc: Three of the team's youngest members compete for the chance to perform a solo, and when Abby comes up with a plan to secure a win, she causes tension among the mums.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: High Court enforcement officers Paul Bohill and Steve and Ben Pinner face their biggest eviction yet - taking on squatters in a large central London office block. With the help of the police, they try to remove a suspected group of 70 from the building, but with a barricade in place, the team faces a challenging operation ahead. Elsewhere, officers are confronted by an army of family and friends when they attempt to enforce a writ at the property of a debtor, and face a difficult eviction at the north London home of a heavily pregnant tenant and her family, after the council fails to pay the rent to the landlord.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Sonya believes Amy is harbouring a crush for Toadie, Elly becomes a target for Susan's irritation and Sheila takes Karl on for the leadership role on the Liveability committee.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Hunter's search for his father is fruitless, so Olivia suggests he contact his grandmother. Alf is glad to have Roo home, but it is clear that something is bothering her.(n)

programme.title: Dance Moms

programme.title: Celebrity Big Brother
programme.desc: Highlights of the housemates' past 24 hours under the all-seeing eye of Big Brother as the celebrities cope with living under constant surveillance, with all the arguments and alliances, as well as the revelations in the diary room.(n)

programme.title: Dance Moms

programme.title: 3 Days to Kill
programme.desc: A CIA agent learns he is dying, and decides to quit the agency so he can spend his last few months trying to rebuild his relationship with his estranged daughter. He is tempted to go back on his word when an old colleague offers him an experimental drug that could save his life - if he agrees to carry out one last mission. Action thriller, starring Kevin Costner, Amber Heard and Hailee Steinfeld.(n)

programme.desc: Kyle is unimpressed when he realises younger children enjoy too much rehashed material. Meanwhile, Randy worries he cannot go through with a concert he is booked to play at with rappers Nicki Minaj and Iggy Azalea.(n)

programme.desc: The Canadian government introduce a new app about Terrance and Phillip, and Stan becomes addicted to the game.(n)

programme.desc: Dorothy remains worried by Lucas's violent outburst, and on learning that the Wizard's guards are after her, heads to the Witch of the East's castle. In the city, the Wizard faces public protests by rebellious witches, while Jack and Tip learn the truth about Tip's condition.(n)

programme.desc: Quentin embarks upon a drug-induced trip which enables him to see into other worlds, and he encounters Julia's shade from an alternative time loop.(n)

programme.title: When Kids Kill
programme.desc: Aaron Roach Bridgeman explores court restrictions and anonymity orders placed on child murderers, meaning the media cannot name perpetrators until the age of 18.(n)

programme.desc: Jill's competitive nature comes to the fore. Meanwhile, the mothers take Abby speed-dating in the hope the company of a good man will make her nicer to the girls.(n)

programme.title: Dance Moms

programme.desc: Hyde has a party at his and Bud's place, but when Eric gets drunk Red is forced to intervene. Meanwhile, Jackie chats up a man her mother dated 20 years previously.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids

programme.title: 8 Simple Rules
programme.desc: Paul's well-meaning advice causes Kyle and Bridget to split up, and Kerry's first date goes well - but she is later dejected that the boy in question fails to return her phone calls. Comedy, starring John Ritter and Katey Sagal.(n)

programme.desc: Paul challenges everyone in the family to give up their bad habits for one week, and whoever wins gets to choose their holiday destination. However, the contest is threatened by a variety of vices. Starring John Ritter and Katey Sagal.(n)

Brian and Graham head to Swindon Town football club to recover a debt, while Paul and Ben have difficulty evicting a couple from a house in Kent after learning they have six children and nowhere else to go.(n)

Martial arts adventure, starring Jet Li and Jackie Chan.(n)

programme.title: PS I Love You
programme.desc: Widowed Holly feels she cannot cope following the death of her husband. However, on her birthday, she receives a letter he wrote to her just before he died, encouraging her to live life to the full rather than languish in sorrow. This is just the first in a series of messages, each one sending her on wild misadventures and helping her to move on. Romantic drama based on Cecelia Ahern's novel, starring Hilary Swank, Gerard Butler and Lisa Kudrow.(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2
programme.desc: In this charming sequel to the 2002 sleeper hit, Toula's family throws an even bigger Greek wedding for her parents, who learn they never officially tied the knot. Meanwhile, she deals with a daughter who's eager to escape from her overbearing clan(n)

programme.title: The Intern
programme.desc: A 70-year-old widower comes out of retirement to take an internship at a trendy start-up fashion company, and unexpectedly becomes a confidant for the overwhelmed young CEO(n)

programme.title: Sweet November
programme.desc: Romantic melodrama about a young woman who begins a new relationship with a different man each month in order to help them develop into more compassionate individuals. However, there are unexpected repercussions for both parties when she attempts to bring meaning to the life of a hard-hearted, career-centred business executive(n)

programme.title: The Danish Girl

programme.title: Robin Hood: Prince of Thieves

programme.title: The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor

programme.title: A Serious Man
programme.desc: Meek physics professor Larry Gopnic finds his life unravelling as he deals with his cheating wife, his layabout brother, his disobedient children, threats to his tenure and a next-door neighbour who likes to sunbathe in the nude(n)

programme.title: Cast Away
programme.desc: Two-time Academy Award winner Tom Hanks delivers an outstanding performance in this excellent Oscar winning Drama. Chuck Noland is a Fed-Ex manager who demands that everything must be on time and travels the world to make sure punctuality is on top of everything else. He has a girlfriend, Kelly, with whom he is deeply in love with and family he hardly sees. When work intrudes on Christmas Eve, Chuck has a quick gift exchange in the car and kisses Kelly goodbye. He boards a delivery plane going overseas which gets caught in a horrendous storm and crashes into the Pacific. The sole survivor Chuck washes up on a remote island along with several Fed-Ex packages that he must use for supplies. With limited luxury, he adapts to the island over the course of 1,500 nights(n)

programme.title: Wall Street
programme.desc: An ambitious stock broker becomes the protégé of a ruthless corporate shark. Eventually the billionaire takes a financial interest in the airline company where the protégé's father has been employed for decades(n)

programme.title: The Martian
programme.desc: After an exploratory mission goes awry, lone astronaut Mark Watney (Matt Damon) is left for dead on the hostile surface of Mars and must use his scientific ingenuity to homestead an enclosed habitat where he can survive. Meanwhile, the astronauts he left behind realize the severity of his plight and join forces with an international coalition of scientists to launch a rescue mission in defiance of NASA protocol(n)

programme.title: Morgan

programme.title: The Soloist

Steve Lopez is a disenchanted journalist dealing with a recent divorce. Steve is wandering through Los Angeles' Skid Row when he spots Ayers. programme.title: Capote
programme.desc: Philip Seymour Hoffman won a much-deserved Best Actor Oscar for his uncannily astounding performance as "In Cold Blood" author Truman Capote. The exceptional biopic spans the six years Capote spent working on his 1966 masterpiece. Catherine Keener received a Best Supporting Oscar nod as Capote's friend and researcher Harper Lee, who a few years later would publish "To Kill a Mockingbird." Dan Futterman's script was also Oscar-nominated. Clifton Collins Jr., Chris Cooper, Bob Balaban, Amy Ryan(n)

programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. programme.title: Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl
programme.desc: Following his surprise-hit American remake of The Ring in 2002, director Gore Verbinski took on Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl, the second of recent films to be based upon Disney theme-park rides (the first being The Country Bears). When Elizabeth Swann (Keira Knightley), the daughter of Governor Swann (Jonathan Pryce) is kidnapped by a group of pirates led by Captain Barbossa (Geoffrey Rush) and taken aboard their ship, The Black Pearl, Will Turner (Orlando Bloom), the young man who loves Elizabeth despite the fact that she is promised to another, sets out to rescue her. But he can't do it alone, so he enlists the help of swashbuckling ship captain Jack Sparrow (Johnny Depp). Together the two chase after The Black Pearl, but they soon discover that the captain and crew aren't your average pirates. Cursed to remain between the living and the dead, Barbossa and his men look like skeletons when basked in the moonlight. When it is revealed that the only thing that can break the curse is Elizabeth's blood, Jack and Will are faced with a race against time and a battle against the undead to save the Governor's daughter(n)

programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. It mixes news---from a religious perspective---with inspirational interviews with celebrities, along with Bible readings and entertainment. Conservative icon (and 1988 presidential candidate) Pat Robertson founded the hugely popular program from a 1963 fund-raising pledge effort on UHF TV in Virginia(n)

programme.title: Mirror Mirror
programme.desc: Julia Roberts, Armie Hammer and Lily Collins star in Tarsem Singh's reworking of the Snow White fairy tale. When her father the King goes missing on a quest to save his kingdom, the 18-year-old Snow White is left alone with her stepmother the Queen, who has raised the girl since her natural mother died giving birth to her. This devotion should not be mistaken for love, for the Queen is utterly self-absorbed and evil. And when both women are equally attracted to the visiting Prince Alcott, the monarch decides to kill her rival. But Brighton, the henchman told to dispatch the princess, can't bring himself to fulfil his task and lets her go. And thus, deep in the forest, Snow White discovers a band of brigand dwarves who are only too happy to help her win the hand of her prince and depose her murderous stepmother. There are some violent scenes (hence the PG rating), but the general tone is humorous, and the acting at times plays second fiddle to the astonishing set and costume design (Eiko Ishioka was posthumously Oscar-nominated for the Best Achievement in Costume Design)(n)

programme.title: The Three Stooges
programme.desc: Mummy's Dummies. This time we're in ancient Egypt, where the Three Stooges own a used-chariot dealership ("I'm Honest Moe, he's Honest Shemp, and that's...that's Larry"). When they bamboozle the Captain of the Royal Guard (Ralph Dunn) out of 400 shekels for a defective chariot, the Stooges are arrested and brought before the mighty King Rootentooten (Vernon Dent). Sentenced to be thrown to the crocodiles, the boys save themselves by curing the King's toothache, whereupon they are appointed Royal Chamberlains--and in this capacity, our heroes expose a crooked tax collector (Philip Van Zandt). Highlights include Shemp's disguise as the mummy of the late, great King Put-n-take-it(n)

programme.title: Sudden Death
programme.desc: Jean Claude Van Damme headlines this taut and exciting actioner. Van Damme is Darren McCord, who as the story begins is seen trapped in a blazing building, trying to save a child. The experience is traumatic and two years later, he has become fire marshal of the Pittsburgh Civic Arena. One night he and his two kids are attending a play-off hockey game between the Penguins and the Blackhawks. Also attending the game is the vice president of the US. He has no idea that he is the target of an assassination conspiracy that is to occur that very night. The leader of the killers is Joshua Foss. The villains stage a raid and begin holding the entire coliseum hostage. The crooks will only free the hostages if they receive $1.7 billion from the government in three increments at the end of each period. If their demands aren't met, the bad-guys will detonate the 10 bombs they have stashed beneath the arena. Now it is up to McCord to find those bombs and stops them(n)

programme.title: Street Fighter
programme.desc: Live-action rendition of the futuristic video game about a soldier trying to liberate hostages held by a dictator(n)

programme.title: The Italian Job
programme.desc: Mark Wahlberg stars in this affectionate remake of the British classic as Charlie Croker, who, after taking over from John Bridger as the leader of a gang of thieves, celebrates his new status with a multi-million-dollar job in Venice. But gang member Steve Frezelli double-crosses his friends, kills Bridger and leaves the rest for dead. The gang survive and Croker spends a year tracking the traitor, using the safecracking skills of Bridger's daughter Stella to rob Steve and avenge her father's death. F Gary Gray's all-action movie does, of course, include the famous Minis sequence, with several of the cast doing their own driving(n)

programme.title: Goodfellas
programme.desc: Martin Scorsese directs this hard-hitting, highly-acclaimed contemporary gangster drama, based on the memoirs of a real-life Mafia 'wise guy'. Set on the streets of New York, the film follows the rise through the ranks of organised crime of Henry Hill, a small-time hustler who enters the sprawling crime organisation as a runner for neighbourhood don Paul Sorvino. Moving through the mob milieu, Hill comes into contact with veteran Irish hood Robert De Niro, who takes the youngster under his wing to teach him the unwritten rules of the underworld and impress upon him the value of loyalty to the members of his surrogate 'family'(n)

programme.title: The Shawshank Redemption
programme.desc: Drama about the relationship struck up between two inmates of Shawshank State Prison over two decades. When a New England banker begins a double life sentence in 1946 for the murder of his wife and her lover, he encounters the prison 'fixer' and they become friends. programme.title: Dragon: The Bruce Lee Story
programme.desc: The brief but eventful life of actor and martial arts trailblazer Bruce Lee is portrayed in this drama, based on a biography written by his widow Linda Lee Caldwell. Lee is introduced to the study of martial arts as a child living in Hong Kong by his father (Ric Young); the father dreamed that a demonic armored dragon would take his son from him, and wanted young Bruce to be able to protect himself. Bruce continues his training as he grows to adulthood, and after the cocky teenaged Lee (Jason Scott Lee, no relation to Bruce) seriously injures a prominent British citizen while fighting a gang of troublemakers at a dance, he's sent to San Francisco. While working as a dishwasher, Bruce begins to study philosophy, and in time develops a personal martial arts discipline, Jeet Kune-Do, which blends Kung Fu fighting techniques with lessons gained from his philosophical research. Bruce decides to open a martial arts academy on the advice of his fiancée Linda (Lauren Holly); Linda and Bruce encounter resistance as a mixed-race couple, especially from Linda's mother Vivian (Michael Learned), and Bruce earns the enmity of traditional Chinese martial arts experts for his new style. But after a strong showing in several public tournaments, Bruce's fighting skill and charisma attracts the attention of TV producer Bill Krieger (Robert Wagner). Bruce is cast as Kato, the karate-trained sidekick on the series The Green Hornet, and while the show is short-lived in America, it's a huge success in Asia, leading to a series of films based around Bruce's remarkable fighting skills. Sadly, shortly before the release of the film that would make him a major screen star in the United States, Enter The Dragon, a mysterious brain disorder sends Lee into a coma that soon kills him. In a tragedy with eerie timing, Bruce Lee's real-life son Brandon Lee died shortly before this film was released, the result of an accidental shooting while completing the picture The Crow(n)

programme.title: The Terminator
programme.desc: Endlessly imitated, The Terminator made the reputation of cowriter/director James Cameron -- who would go on to make 1997's titanic Titanic -- and solidified the stardom of Arnold Schwarzenegger. The movie begins in a post-apocalyptic 2029, when Los Angeles has been largely reduced to rubble and is under the thumb of all-powerful ruling machines. Kyle Reese (Michael Biehn), a member of the human resistance movement, is teleported back to 1984. His purpose: to rescue Sarah Connor (Linda Hamilton), the mother of the man who will lead the 21st-century rebels against the tyrannical machines, from being assassinated before she can give birth. Likewise thrust back to 1984 is The Terminator (Schwarzenegger), a grim, well-armed, virtually indestructable cyborg who has been programmed to eliminate Sarah Connor. After killing two "Sarah Connors" who turn out to be the wrong women, he finally aims his gunsights at the genuine article. This is the film in which Schwarzenegger declared "I'll be baaaack" -- and back he was, in "kinder and gentler" form, in the even more successful Terminator 2: Judgment Day (1991)(n)

programme.title: 2 Fast 2 Furious
programme.desc: Former LA cop Brian now makes his living driving in illegal street races in Miami. Squeezed by the FBI, he agrees to set up druglord Verone for a king-sized bust(n)

programme.title: Point Break

programme.title: Rendition
programme.desc: Gavin Hood's thriller stars Reese Witherspoon as Isabella Fields El-Ibrahimi, the wife of American-Egyptian chemical engineer Anwar El-Ibrahimi. When Anwar disappears on his way home from a conference in South Africa, she is driven frantic trying to find proof of his whereabouts in the face of official denial. Anwar is being held as a suspected terrorist in secrecy in Marrakech, where CIA operative Douglas Freeman is reluctantly involved in his torture. Meanwhile, one of the torturer's daughters, Fatima, is secretly in love with a fellow student who may be following extreme paths. As Hood brings the strands together, the various characters' actions intertwine, moving towards a dramatic conclusion(n)

The Rhea-M comet starts revolving round earth and provokes all machinery to become their own masters and revolt against mankind. A group of people find shelter in a relay station and are surrounded by a horde of raging trucks. After a tremendous fight. Bill, Bubba, Brett and some others manage to reach the coast and set sail to an island void of technology(n)

programme.title: Stir of Echoes: The Homecoming

programme.title: Species: The Awakening
programme.desc: A brilliant and beautiful college professor makes a terrifying discovery about herself after experiencing a frightening blackout in the latest installment of the shocking Species series. Miranda Hollander (Helena Mattsson) is a genius who is about to discover just how little she truly knows about the universe. Upon awakening from a mysterious blackout, Miranda is horrified to find herself surrounded by a mass of mutilated human bodies. When Miranda approaches her uncle in hopes of discovering an answer to this disturbing development, she is shaken to learn that she is in fact a half-human/half-alien clone. Now, the only hope for Miranda is to flee to Mexico with her uncle and seek out the scientist who created her. But it won't be long before Miranda is unable to suppress the killer instincts boiling up within her, and with an endless horde of murderous hybrids on their trail, it's only a matter of time before planet Earth becomes the ultimate extraterrestrial battleground(n)

programme.title: The Cotton Club

programme.title: Bug
programme.desc: Academy Award-winning Exorcist director William Friedkin scuttles deep into the darkest recesses of the traumatized human psyche with this tale of a lonely bartender haunted by the long-ago disappearance of her young son, and the paranoia that emerges when she enters into a tentative relationship with a deeply disturbed drifter. Adapted from the off-Broadway play by Tracy Letts, Bug centers on Agnes (Ashley Judd), who tends bar alongside pal R.C. (Lynn Collins), and has recently moved into a shoddy roadside motel in hopes of avoiding her menacing and recently paroled ex-husband, Jerry (Harry Connick Jr.). Upon making the acquaintance of subdued former soldier Peter (Michael Shannon, repeating his stage role), a veteran of the first Gulf War, Agnes finally senses that things are looking up. Quietly charming despite his melancholy aura, Peter soon reveals to Agnes that he contracted a "bug" while serving in the Middle East, and that it may have been deliberately administered as part of a secret military medical experiment. Convinced that the microscopic insects are quickly multiplying just under the surface of his skin and that they have now infected Agnes as well, Peter soon descends into a psychotic rage as he resorts to increasingly desperate measures to purge himself of the offending subdermal arthropods(n)

programme.title: Johnson Family Vacation

programme.title: Kindergarten Cop

programme.title: The Scorpion King

programme.title: Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World
programme.desc: Director Peter Weir's first turn behind the camera since 1998's critically acclaimed The Truman Show, Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World is based on two Napoleonic War-era adventure novels in author Patrick O'Brian's Aubrey/Maturin series, Master and Commander and The Far Side of the World. Russell Crowe stars as Captain Jack Aubrey, a high-seas adventurer who maintains a strong bond with ship-surgeon Stephen Maturin (Paul Bettany). After conquering much of Europe already, Napoleon's forces have set their sights on taking Britain, so Aubrey and the crew of his ship, the HMS Surprise, take to the Pacific to intercept any attacking ships from the French fleet. When Aubrey eyes a renegade French super-frigate, the Surprise pursues, leading to an adrenaline-charged chase through the distant reaches of the sea. Edward Woodall, James D'Arcy, and Lee Ingleby also star as members of the Surprise's crew(n)

programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park Summer Special
programme.desc: Ben Fogle meets an animal with poison so toxic it can stop a human heart and wildlife cameraman Louis Labrom attempts to capture the Siberian tigers in super slow-motion.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore a flat in a 1960s tower block in London, a semi-detached property in Staffordshire and an unusual cottage in Cornwall. They then speak to the buyers about their plans for the future.(n)

programme.title: Matron, Medicine and Me: 70 Years of the NHS
programme.desc: Miriam Margolyes travels to Glasgow, where her father trained as a doctor, finding out how he helped fulfil the NHS mission of providing `doctors on the doorstep' across the nation.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Angela Rippon and Julia Somerville answers viewers' questions on keeping food fresh, and reveal how most households are getting it wrong when it comes to what should and should not be kept in the fridge.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: At Newark International Antiques and Collectors Fair in Nottinghamshire, experts Caroline Hawley and David Harper help two teams pick up items to sell for profit at auction. Presented by Christine Trevanion.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: Joe refuses to take no for an answer with Bridget. Conor and Liam face difficult questions, while Nikki is annoyed by Rory's tactics.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: Matt Allwright hosts the quiz in which contestants must answer questions to help crack a three-digit code that will open a safe full of money. The jackpot starts at £3,000 and each time contestants fail - and that could be after just one wrong answer - they have to leave immediately and another £500 is added to the prize. Matt is assisted by quiz expert Lesley-Anne Brewis.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson heads to south Wales, where he helps a couple with a £350,000 budget find a `forever' home in the country. The presenter is also given special access to the manufacturer of the nation's coins, the Royal Mint.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents from Norwich Cathedral, where experts Thomas Plant and Kate Bateman find a religious relic from France and a Martin Brothers vase to send to auction.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Alex Jones present the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: As Linda and Mick struggle to pick up the pieces after their argument, the Carters suspect all is not well and start to ask questions, while Stacey is shocked to learn why Whitney was thrown out of the Vic. Fi pushes Max to get more information on the council, Lauren is taken aback when Cora arrives and questions her on the engagement, and Honey suggests Ingrid, Jack and the children should join her and Billy on their camping trip.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents further coverage of the seventh night at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park. With Usain Bolt opting not to defend his 200m title, a new champion will be crowned this evening, with Yohan Blake and Wayde van Niekerk among the favourites going into the championships. The 400m hurdles final also takes place, with a strong American contingent led by Dalilah Muhammad expected to challenge. Plus, medals are decided in the men's triple jump, and places in the women's 200m final are confirmed. With analysis from Michael Johnson, Colin Jackson and Denise Lewis, and commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Brendan Foster and Steve Backley.(n)

programme.title: Stacey Dooley Investigates
programme.sub-title: Stacey Dooley Investigates: Kids Selling Drugs Online.
programme.desc: The presenter goes undercover in the growing criminal world of Britain's digital drug dealers. Using fake profiles on various popular apps, she reveals how easy it is for children and young teenagers to get their hands on Class A drugs via social media platforms. She then gains access to one of the gangs, to find out about their trade, before asking what can be done to curb this worrying problem.(n)

programme.title: Queer Britain
programme.desc: Riyadh Khalef explores homelessness in the LGBTQ community, meeting a rough sleeper on the streets of Birmingham and following a man being rehomed into a temporary flat in Scotland.(n)

programme.title: Queer Britain
programme.desc: Riyadh Khalaf heads into the world of 'queer porn' to meet the producers and performers bringing different sexuality and identities to the screen.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park Summer Special
programme.desc: Ben Fogle catches up with a pregnant anteater that is due any day, one of the keepers prepares to leave and vets try to find out what is wrong with a much-loved tapir. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore a Georgian flat in Burton-on-Trent, a former public convenience in Kirkcaldy, and a mid-terraced house in Rhondda before they are sold at auction, before meeting their new owners to discuss their plans for the properties.(n)

programme.title: Matron, Medicine and Me: 70 Years of the NHS
programme.desc: Antiques expert Eric Knowles explores how science has improved diagnosis and the quality of life of people with cancer over the years, and celebrates NHS porters. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: A woman who spends only a fraction of the average weekly shop reveals her secrets and the mark-up on gift hampers is investigated. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents from Newark, where he goes deep underground to discover a fascinating piece of local history, while Philip Serrell and Charles Hanson help the teams.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: Angela contemplates a criminal act, Paudge fears that Nikki will find a missing suspect, and the Kielys reach a tipping point.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: Matt Allwright hosts the quiz in which contestants must answer questions to help crack a three-digit code that will open a safe full of money. The jackpot starts at £3,000 and each time contestants fail - and that could be after just one wrong answer - they have to leave immediately and another £500 is added to the prize.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman and Jules Hudson look back at two searches in Oxfordshire, while Jules also learns how to make a famous British accessory and Nicki visits Blenheim Palace.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: At Ragley Hall in Warwickshire, the 17th-century Palladian house owned by the Marquess of Hertford, antiques experts Charlie Ross and Will Axon find great treasures brought by visitors including an interesting busby hat. Will gets a surprise when a Worcester coffee set goes under the hammer, and presenter Paul Martin explores the Battle of Edgehill.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Alex Jones reach the final stop of the Big Causeway Crawl.(n)

programme.title: Still Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville tries to sell some damaged tins of chilli beans and prove the erotic power of salami, but finds himself confronted with a customer's unhappy husband. Cyril and Eric seek advice on how to impress their wives, while Mrs Featherstone's efforts to secure Mr Newbold as a fourth husband suffer a setback.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Steven panics when Lauren insists on visiting her mother and looks to Max to help him stop her. Max also has his own problems as a pushy Carmel invites him to a family dinner, where his dismissive mood looks set to ruin things. Jack agrees to camping with Billy and Honey.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.sub-title: World Athletics Championships 2017: Day Eight - Evening Session.
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents further coverage of the eighth night at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park. Defending champions are expected to go head-to-head with Olympic gold medallists in both the women's 200m and 3,000m steeplechase, with Dafne Schippers up against Rio 400m winner Shaunae Miller-Uibo in the sprint event, and Hyvin Kiyeng facing Ruth Jebet across the barriers. Medals are also decided in the men's hammer, and the women's long jump concludes. With analysis from Michael Johnson, Colin Jackson and Denise Lewis, and commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Brendan Foster and Steve Backley.(n)

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee and Lucy decide to attend a marriage counselling session. However, events soon put their relationship under further strain. Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton.(n)

programme.title: Strictly Ballroom
programme.desc: A rebellious dancer's unconventional style earns him the disapproval of the ballroom establishment and causes his partner to walk out on him. Needing a replacement before a high-profile championship, he turns to an awkward beginner whose footwork blossoms under his influence as romance develops between them. Australian comedy, directed by Baz Luhrmann and starring Paul Mercurio, Tara Morice and Bill Hunter.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Entertainment guru and Good Morning Britain star Richard Arnold joins Brian Conley on the sofa to talk about the television that shaped him, and there is a tribute to Terry Wogan.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park Summer Special
programme.desc: Keepers in charge of one of the planet's rarest animals get a fright and Jean Johansson joins Anne the elephant to see just how much water her trunk can hold.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Paul Laidlaw presents from the Westpoint Arena in Exeter as two people take on their former teacher and her husband, with help from experts Gary Pe and Charlie Ross.(n)

programme.title: Nadiya's British Food Adventure
programme.desc: The Great British Bake Off 2015 champion Nadiya Hussain embarks on a culinary road trip around Britain, meeting with producers, farmers and fishermen across the country as she creates her own recipes inspired by their produce. In the first episode Nadiya begins her tour in the Home Counties, where she visits an asparagus farm in Oxford, before trying her hand at food smoking in Milton Keynes.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Ally McGrath creates an inventive fish dish based on his summer memories of rock pooling in the River Tweed. Meanwhile, Angela Malik takes on the ancient skill of preparing sashimi, and defending regional winner Michael Bremner uses turbot for his meal, but which will impress the veteran chef?.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents a quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: A Taste of Britain
programme.desc: Janet Street-Porter and Brian Turner head to the Oare Marshes in Kent, where they tour the ancient town of Faversham and explore the Goods Shed Farmers Market in Canterbury. Plus, chef Rafael Lopez uses local ingredients to create a lunch of lamb cutlets and vegetables.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: A journey around some of the most dramatic coastlines in Europe, uncovering the stories behind how these landscapes have shaped history.(n)

programme.title: Viva Las Vegas
programme.desc: A charismatic racing driver arrives in the city to prepare for its first grand prix. Unfortunately, his car has no engine, so to make the money to buy one he takes a job as a casino waiter. However, he loses focus when he falls in love, leaving a rival with the means to steal the race and his girl. Musical, starring Elvis Presley, who died 40 years ago on August 16, with Ann-Margret, Cesare Danova and William Demarest.(n)

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough looks at vibrantly coloured monkeys in Venezuela, Costa Rica and West Africa. He encounters the red howler, which boasts one of the loudest calls in the wild, a capuchin that uses a tree as an anvil, the guenon, which communicates via facial expression, and the ground-dwelling gelada baboon.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Will Axon and Mark Stacey begin their journey in Crystal Palace, south London, before travelling to Piccadilly in the centre of the city to visit the home of the Kennel Club. They then make their way to the final auction in Southend-on-Sea, Essex, to see who can make the most profit from their haul.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents coverage of the seventh night of events at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park. The women's 5,000m heats has strong British representation, with Laura Muir, Steph Twell and Eilish McColgan all looking to progress, while Katarina Johnson-Thompson looks to qualify for the high jump final four days after completing the heptathlon. With analysis from Michael Johnson, Colin Jackson and Denise Lewis, and commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Brendan Foster and Steve Backley. Coverage continues on BBC1. Live coverage of the USPGA Championship golf begins on the interactive service at 6pm.(n)

programme.title: 10 Puppies and Us
programme.desc: Emma Lowe goes in search of a special puppy, wanting one that will act as a therapy dog for her four-year-old son, who has Down's syndrome, and soothe him when he is distressed. Meanwhile, newlyweds Leigh and Bella are forced to call in behaviourist Louise Glazebrook when their new pug Butch Cassidy has trouble sleeping on a night. There are also catch-ups with salon owner Hannah, who is taking on her third Chihuahua, and psychic Delia as she welcomes the big-breed Leonberger she fell in love with. But as the small puppy grows, she finds herself completely out of her depth.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Lake
programme.sub-title: Top of the Lake: China Girl: Surrogate.
programme.desc: Robin is galvanised by her new theory about China Girl, taking her inquiry in an entirely new direction. She also begins to relish spending time with Mary - until the arrival of Al Parker from New Zealand threatens her precious new life in Sydney. Julia and Pyke are horrified to learn that Puss intends to marry their daughter, and begin to make their own investigations. But when their snooping leads to a very public confrontation, they are forced to turn to Robin for help. Crime drama, starring Elizabeth Moss, Nicole Kidman and Alice Englert.(n)

programme.title: Athletics: World Championships Highlights
programme.desc: Gabby Logan and Ore Oduba present analysis of the seventh night of events at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, where the finals of the men's 200m and triple jump, and women's 400m hurdles took place. Michael Johnson offers his input.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Golf: USPGA Championship
programme.desc: Eilidh Barbour presents live coverage of the closing stages of day one at the fourth and final Major of the year, held at Quail Hollow Club in Charlotte, North Carolina. Commentary from Peter Alliss, Ken Brown, Maureen Madill and Mark James. Live coverage begins on the interactive service at 6pm.(n)

programme.title: The Sweet Makers
programme.sub-title: The Sweet Makers: A Georgian Treat.
programme.desc: Four modern confectioners use original recipes, equipment and ingredients to recreate the extravagant displays of a Georgian confectionery shop. Guided by food historian Dr Annie Gray and social historian Emma Dabiri, the foursome travel to Bath to experience first-hand the life of confectioners in late 18th and early 19th-century England. The sweet-makers craft everything from towering jellies made from boiled calves feet, glasses of Parmesan ice cream, and a final course featuring an edible landscape.(n)

programme.title: Fight Game: The McGuigans
programme.desc: Having made history with Carl Frampton's world title win in New York, the team prepares Conrad Cummings for his make-or-break bout, and Shane McGuigan and Sophie Leniston get married.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: TV chef Rachel Khoo joins Brian Conley to look back at the classic TV that made her the person she is, including a lasagne loving cat, and a duck that lived in a broom cupboard.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park Summer Special
programme.desc: Ben Fogle meets an animal with poison so toxic it can stop a human heart and wildlife cameraman Louis Labrom attempts to capture the Siberian tigers in super slow-motion.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: At Newark International Antiques and Collectors Fair in Nottinghamshire, experts Caroline Hawley and David Harper help two teams pick up items to sell for profit at auction. Presented by Christine Trevanion.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes steps to ensure that fruits and vegetables give maximum cropping by dispensing advice on the summer pruning of fruit trees as well as revealing how to get the best from tomatoes and chillies. He also recommends plants that will carry on flowering into the autumn. Carol Klein meets writer Roy Lancaster as he reminisces on his life. Roy is a former Gardeners' World presenter, and with the programme's half-centenary in mind Rachel de Thame reflects on how people used to garden 50 years ago. Plus, Joe Swift and Flo Headlam help a community create a garden in Wiltshire.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: An exploration of the history and culture of some of the most extreme locations in Britain. Nick Crane visits the Isles of Scilly, Ruth Goodman walks the dangerous path traversed daily by the Branscombe Cliff farmers in Devon, and Mark Horton investigates the Transatlantic Telegraph service. Meanwhile, Hermione Cockburn learns how the fossil of a large sea creature found at St David's Head, Pembrokeshire, shaped scientists' understanding of Earth's history.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.sub-title: World Athletics Championships 2017: Day Eight - Morning Session.
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents coverage of the morning session on day eight at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, including the opening three disciplines of the decathlon - the 100m, long jump and shot put, as the likes of Damian Warner and Kevin Mayer compete for the now-retired Ashton Eaton's crown. Plus, the opening round of the women's 100m hurdles and the men's high jump qualifying.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: A Taste of Britain
programme.desc: Janet Street-Porter and Brian Turner visit Norfolk, where they visit a micro-herb farm and take a seal-watching trip from Morston Quay. The chef visits old friend Galton Blackiston at his restaurant, where head chef Richard Bainbridge creates a dish that reflects the local area. Dishes include grey mullet and brown shrimp in a herb sauce, and spatchcock quail with pearl barley stew.(n)

programme.title: Father of the Bride
programme.desc: A doting father recounts the story of his daughter's wedding from the announcement of her engagement to the big day itself. The experience presents him with a series of challenges as he deals with an escalating budget, tension with his new in-laws and the mixed emotions of losing his little girl. Comedy, starring Spencer Tracy and Elizabeth Taylor.(n)

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the startling similarities between humans and great apes, meeting an orang-utan able to row boats and wash clothes and a gorilla that can communicate using sign language. He also traces the history of human settlement and considers the future of population control and food production.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Mark Stacey and Will Axon begin their final leg on the road in Gosfield, Essex, travelling through Finchingfield and St Albans in their search for collectibles before finishing at an auction in Ruislip, Greater London.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.sub-title: World Athletics Championships 2017: Day Eight - Evening Session.
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents coverage of the eighth night of events at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park. The women's long jump final gets under way and is expected to see a close battle between the likes of Brittany Reece, Tianna Bartoletta and Ivana Spanovic. On the track, semi-finals take place in the women's 100m hurdles and 800m, and men's 1500m. With commentary by Steve Cram, Brendan Foster, Andrew Cotter and Steve Backley, and analysis from Michael Johnson, Denise Lewis and Colin Jackson. Coverage continues on BBC1. Live coverage of the USPGA Championship golf is available on the interactive service.(n)

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: A team of reptile lovers take on three background actors in the quiz testing general knowledge and lateral thinking. The players must make connections between four things that may at first not appear to be linked, with one set of clues consisting of bubble, indemnity, Dutch and entendre. Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don gives advice on how to cut and maintain hedges as well as ideas on growing fruit in pots, while Adam Frost uncovers the secrets of successful planting combinations in an Oxfordshire garden. Carol Klein chooses varieties of late flowering clematis as her plant of the month, Nick Bailey travels to the southern tip of Cornwall to seek out a plant which escaped from our gardens and is now threatening rare and native plants, and Mark Lane joins the enthusiasts who have lovingly restored a walled garden in Warwick. Including Weather.(n)

programme.title: Athletics: World Championships Highlights
programme.desc: Gabby Logan and Ore Oduba present analysis of the eighth night of events at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, where four finals took place. Michael Johnson offers his input.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, with Mark Urban.(n)

programme.title: Golf: USPGA Championship
programme.desc: Eilidh Barbour presents live coverage of the closing stages of day two at the fourth and final Major of the year, held at Quail Hollow Club in Charlotte, North Carolina. Commentary from Peter Alliss, Ken Brown, Maureen Madill and Mark James. Live coverage begins on the interactive service at 6pm.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.desc: Mike Read and Steve Wright host the May 3 show, featuring Orchestral Manoeuvres in the Dark, Blancmange, New Order, Kenny Loggins, Jocelyn Brown, the Human League and Duran Duran.(n)

programme.title: Sword, Musket & Machine Gun: Britain's Armed History
programme.desc: Sam Willis traces the evolution of weaponry in Britain, beginning by getting to grips with the swords, lances and shields used on the battlefield 1,000 years ago.(n)

programme.title: Andrew Marr's The Making of Modern Britain
programme.desc: Andrew Marr provides an insight into Britain at the dawn of the 20th century, highlighting the key moments of the era with archive footage and vivid anecdotes. In the first instalment, he takes a look back at the country mourning the death of Queen Victoria, fighting against the Boers in South Africa, and enjoying the music hall. There are also stories of political intrigue, the beginning of the struggle for women's suffrage, and how a meeting between Mr Rolls and Mr Royce started a revolution in motoring.(n)

programme.title: Wilde
programme.desc: Biopic of author and acclaimed wit Oscar Wilde, focusing on his affair with Lord Alfred Douglas at a time when homosexual liaisons were illegal. Refusing to flee the country when their relationship was uncovered, he was subsequently jailed, enduring two years of hard labour. Starring Stephen Fry, Jude Law, Vanessa Redgrave and Jennifer Ehle.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.desc: Mike Read and Steve Wright host the May 3 show, featuring Orchestral Manoeuvres in the Dark, Blancmange, New Order, Kenny Loggins, Jocelyn Brown, the Human League and Duran Duran.(n)

programme.title: From Andy Pandy to Zebedee: The Golden Age of Children's TV
programme.desc: The story of the struggle to deliver television programmes for children, who were an often overlooked audience in the days before everything went digital. Includes interviews with pioneers of children's TV, such as Bernard Cribbins, Derek Griffiths, Janet Ellis, Johnny Ball and John Craven. Narrated by Nigel Planer.(n)

programme.title: Everyday Miracles: The Genius of Sofas, Stockings and Scanners
programme.desc: Part one of two. Professor Mark Miodownik provides an insight into the design techniques that contributed to the invention and production of everyday objects often taken for granted. He begins by focusing on items found in the home, including razor blades, tights, plywood and foam rubber.(n)

programme.title: Sword, Musket & Machine Gun: Britain's Armed History
