programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: It seems that everyone in the Brown family has a date for Valentine's Day except Agnes, so she turns to the internet to find herself a man. Dermot tries to come up with a loving gesture to prove to Maria he can still be romantic - but he makes the mistake of taking advice from Buster - while Agnes and Winnie are fascinated by Betty's sex manual and Grandad ends up addicted to Viagra. Hit comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll.(n)

programme.title: The Mighty Boosh
programme.desc: Vince decides the duo have failed to find musical success because Howard is too old. Noel Fielding and Julian Barratt star.(n)

programme.title: Floyd on France
programme.desc: The chef visits the Perigord region, beginning in the Dordogne where he prepares a salad with walnut oil. He then travels to the town of Bergerac, touring the market with Bernard Girodel before cooking a crepe omelette with the assistance of Madame Moulin in Tremolat, and ends his journey by visiting the kitchens of Vieux Logis in the village and observes a young chef prepare a fish dish.(n)

programme.title: Floyd on France
programme.desc: The chef visits Gevrey-Chambertin and Dijon in Burgundy, cooking veal with mustard and talking to chef Jean Michel La Fond on a barge on the River Saone. He also serves up a meal of coq au vin for grape pickers on the first day of the harvest, and prepares ham with a wine sauce.(n)

programme.title: John Torode's Korean Food Tour
programme.desc: John heads into the Korean kitchen to find out more about essentials like soy, gochujang and doenjang, before making bossam, a fantastic belly pork dish.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The 12 remaining chefs cook off against each other for the first time and have to create one outstanding dish of their own invention from a selection of meat, fish, fruit and vegetables. To test them even further, the judges have removed all the modern equipment from the kitchen, leaving the contestants to use only the basics of hobs and ovens. The four weakest chefs must return to battle it out for the final two places in the next round and face the challenge of producing a dish using unused ingredients from the previous test.(n)

programme.title: Junior Bake Off
programme.desc: The cooks race to bake a lemon drizzle cake in one hour and create a recipe based on the theme of America. Meanwhile, Aaron Craze finds out about cupcakes.(n)

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: Tom Kerridge is joined by MasterChef: The Professionals judge Monica Galetti for a discussion on simple cooking, revealing how to get maximum flavour with minimal fuss. They go head to head to devise the best fuss-free yet impressive recipe, with Monica pitting her honey-glazed chicken against Tom's celery soup with poached egg and soda bread. Plus, resident drinks expert Joe Wadsack tries out a range of alcohol-free beverages.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Great Britain
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver travels to south Wales, where he learns about how late-19th-century coal boom has continued to influence British food culture to this day. He samples classic Italian home cooking, and visits a mosque and community centre in Tiger Bay. Inspired by his experiences, he cooks a 12-hour rabbit bolognese and lamb lollipops with dips and toasted crunchy nuts.(n)

programme.title: Inside Heston's World
programme.desc: After trials, tribulations and a mighty big move, Heston Blumenthal's Fat Duck restaurant opens its doors to the Australian public for the very first time.(n)

programme.title: John Torode's Korean Food Tour
programme.desc: John heads into the Korean kitchen to find out more about essentials like soy, gochujang and doenjang, before making bossam, a fantastic belly pork dish.(n)

programme.title: Nigella Bites
programme.desc: Nigella focuses on the foods she loves to eat when cooking for one, including a salad with pancetta and parmesan. She also makes lamb chops with a garlicky tahini and lemon sauce.(n)

programme.title: Two Fat Ladies

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The 12 remaining chefs cook off against each other for the first time and have to create one outstanding dish of their own invention from a selection of meat, fish, fruit and vegetables. programme.title: Snakes on a Plane

Ellis and starring Samuel L. Jackson(n)

programme.title: Speed
programme.desc: Keanu Reeves plays Jack Traven, a young cop working with the LAPD bomb squad. Thwarting mad bomber Howard Payne, who has wired up a lift to explode, Traven finds himself the object of revenge. Payne rigs a bomb to a bus which arms when the speed reaches above 50mph and explodes if it drops beneath. With passenger Annie Porter drafted in to replace the injured driver, Traven has to work out how to disarm the bomb and evacuate the passengers while she keeps the bus up to speed in urban LA. Jan de Bont's thriller piles on the action and even after Traven saves everyone on the bus, there's still a roller-coaster finale on a runaway subway train commandeered by Payne(n)

programme.title: Real Time With Bill Maher
programme.sub-title: Al Gore; Ralph Reed; Kristen Soltis Anderson; Joshua Green; Michael Weiss
programme.desc: Al Gore; Ralph Reed; Kristen Soltis Anderson; Joshua Green; Michael Weiss. Former vice president Al Gore and political activist Ralph Reed are the interview guests. The panelists are political consultant Kristen Soltis Anderson, and journalists Joshua Green and Michael Weiss(n)

programme.title: Room 104
programme.desc: Pizza Boy. A pizza delivery boy gets caught up in a couple's twisted games(n)

programme.title: Rails & Ties
programme.desc: Kevin Bacon, Marcia Gay Harden, and Miles Heizer star in director Alison Eastwood's tale of two families locked into an emotional -- and physical -- collision course. There once was a time when Tom and Megan Stark had all the time in the world to take their dream vacation and start a family, but these days the couple's marriage is suffering and their time appears to be running short. Megan has been diagnosed with a potentially terminal illness, and when the prospect of losing his wife becomes too much to bear, railroad engineer Tom seeks escape in his work. On the tracks Tom is in control; all the routes are predetermined and he knows he'll eventually arrive at his destination. But sometimes even the most predictable events can go suddenly awry, and when Tom's train hits a car that was parked on the tracks by a suicidal mother, his life is plunged into ruin. While there was no way that Tom could have possibly stopped the train on time, the grieving conductor's woes are suddenly compounded upon realizing that he may lose his job because of the accident. Not only that, but the deceased woman's son, Davey, is consumed by the guilt that he could do nothing to prevent the accident, and he now places the blame for his mother's death squarely on Tom. But not all sad stories have to end in tragedy, and perhaps in the aftermath of this fateful accident Megan could receive a second chance at fulfilling her dreams, Tom could learn to open his heart before he is consumed by bitterness, and Davey could finally learn the true meaning of family(n)

programme.title: Bratz: The Movie
programme.desc: Four teenage girls try to remain best friends forever and reject snooty cliques as they begin high school together in this family film, based on the popular line of dolls, that's filled with fun, fashion and music. Logan Browning, Janel Parrish, Nathalia Ramos, Skyler Shaye, Chelsea Staub. Directed by Sean McNamara(n)

programme.title: Rat Race
programme.desc: A rich Las Vegas eccentric selects six people to hunt down a $2 million jackpot hidden in New Mexico(n)

programme.title: Collateral Beauty
programme.desc: A New York adman (Will Smith) deals with the heartache of losing a child by writing letters to Time, Death, and Love. He is soon visited by representations of the three concepts, and they, along with his close friends, help him return to some semblance of a normal life. Edward Norton, Kate Winslet, Michael Peña, Helen Mirren, Naomie Harris, Keira Knightley, and Jacob Latimore co-star. Directed by David Frankel(n)

programme.title: Hollywood Ending
programme.desc: A down-on-his luck auteur gets one more chance at the big time -- provided his neuroses don't swallow him whole -- in Woody Allen's 33rd feature release, Hollywood Ending. Allen plays Val Waxman, a one-time cinematic genius who's resorted to taking advertisement work to pay the bills for himself and his airhead live-in girlfriend, Lori (Debra Messing). Val finds his luck is about to change, however, when he receives the script for The City Never Sleeps, a period noir set against the backdrop of 1940s New York City. It seems his ex-wife, Ellie (Tea Leoni), now an executive at Galaxy Pictures, has been pulling for him to direct the picture, claiming he's the only man who can do justice to the script. She even manages to convince her boyfriend, Hal (Treat Williams), Galaxy's high-powered studio head, to take a chance on Val's "unique vision." Just when the cameras are ready to roll, however, Val finds that unique vision in jeopardy -- literally -- as he's struck with a psychosomatic case of blindness. When physicians and psychiatrists fail to cure him, Val contrives a scheme to forge ahead with the picture, for fear of blowing his one last chance at greatness. Hollywood Ending co-stars George Hamilton and Mark Rydell(n)

programme.title: Suicide Squad
programme.desc: A team of incarcerated supervillains, including Deadshot, Harley Quinn, Enchantress, El Diablo and Killer Croc, are recruited by the government for a dangerous mission in exchange for reduced sentences(n)

programme.title: Phone Booth

Armed with a high-powered sniper's rifle, the anonymous caller soon proves his prowess and presents Shepard with a choice: convince the police of his story before they shoot him or drop the phone and be shot. His only hope lies in self-abasement and facing up to the truths of his life(n)

programme.title: Speed
programme.desc: Keanu Reeves plays Jack Traven, a young cop working with the LAPD bomb squad. Thwarting mad bomber Howard Payne, who has wired up a lift to explode, Traven finds himself the object of revenge. Payne rigs a bomb to a bus which arms when the speed reaches above 50mph and explodes if it drops beneath. With passenger Annie Porter drafted in to replace the injured driver, Traven has to work out how to disarm the bomb and evacuate the passengers while she keeps the bus up to speed in urban LA. Jan de Bont's thriller piles on the action and even after Traven saves everyone on the bus, there's still a roller-coaster finale on a runaway subway train commandeered by Payne(n)

programme.title: Real Time With Bill Maher
programme.sub-title: Al Gore; Ralph Reed; Kristen Soltis Anderson; Joshua Green; Michael Weiss
programme.desc: Al Gore; Ralph Reed; Kristen Soltis Anderson; Joshua Green; Michael Weiss. Former vice president Al Gore and political activist Ralph Reed are the interview guests. The panelists are political consultant Kristen Soltis Anderson, and journalists Joshua Green and Michael Weiss(n)

programme.title: Room 104
programme.desc: Pizza Boy. A pizza delivery boy gets caught up in a couple's twisted games(n)

programme.title: Rails & Ties
programme.desc: Kevin Bacon, Marcia Gay Harden, and Miles Heizer star in director Alison Eastwood's tale of two families locked into an emotional -- and physical -- collision course. There once was a time when Tom and Megan Stark had all the time in the world to take their dream vacation and start a family, but these days the couple's marriage is suffering and their time appears to be running short. Megan has been diagnosed with a potentially terminal illness, and when the prospect of losing his wife becomes too much to bear, railroad engineer Tom seeks escape in his work. On the tracks Tom is in control; all the routes are predetermined and he knows he'll eventually arrive at his destination. But sometimes even the most predictable events can go suddenly awry, and when Tom's train hits a car that was parked on the tracks by a suicidal mother, his life is plunged into ruin. While there was no way that Tom could have possibly stopped the train on time, the grieving conductor's woes are suddenly compounded upon realizing that he may lose his job because of the accident. Not only that, but the deceased woman's son, Davey, is consumed by the guilt that he could do nothing to prevent the accident, and he now places the blame for his mother's death squarely on Tom. But not all sad stories have to end in tragedy, and perhaps in the aftermath of this fateful accident Megan could receive a second chance at fulfilling her dreams, Tom could learn to open his heart before he is consumed by bitterness, and Davey could finally learn the true meaning of family(n)

programme.title: Bratz: The Movie
programme.desc: Four teenage girls try to remain best friends forever and reject snooty cliques as they begin high school together in this family film, based on the popular line of dolls, that's filled with fun, fashion and music. Logan Browning, Janel Parrish, Nathalia Ramos, Skyler Shaye, Chelsea Staub. Directed by Sean McNamara(n)

programme.title: Rat Race
programme.desc: A rich Las Vegas eccentric selects six people to hunt down a $2 million jackpot hidden in New Mexico(n)

programme.title: Collateral Beauty
programme.desc: A New York adman (Will Smith) deals with the heartache of losing a child by writing letters to Time, Death, and Love. He is soon visited by representations of the three concepts, and they, along with his close friends, help him return to some semblance of a normal life. Edward Norton, Kate Winslet, Michael Peña, Helen Mirren, Naomie Harris, Keira Knightley, and Jacob Latimore co-star. Directed by David Frankel(n)

programme.title: Hollywood Ending
programme.desc: A down-on-his luck auteur gets one more chance at the big time -- provided his neuroses don't swallow him whole -- in Woody Allen's 33rd feature release, Hollywood Ending. Allen plays Val Waxman, a one-time cinematic genius who's resorted to taking advertisement work to pay the bills for himself and his airhead live-in girlfriend, Lori (Debra Messing). Val finds his luck is about to change, however, when he receives the script for The City Never Sleeps, a period noir set against the backdrop of 1940s New York City. It seems his ex-wife, Ellie (Tea Leoni), now an executive at Galaxy Pictures, has been pulling for him to direct the picture, claiming he's the only man who can do justice to the script. She even manages to convince her boyfriend, Hal (Treat Williams), Galaxy's high-powered studio head, to take a chance on Val's "unique vision." Just when the cameras are ready to roll, however, Val finds that unique vision in jeopardy -- literally -- as he's struck with a psychosomatic case of blindness. When physicians and psychiatrists fail to cure him, Val contrives a scheme to forge ahead with the picture, for fear of blowing his one last chance at greatness. Hollywood Ending co-stars George Hamilton and Mark Rydell(n)

programme.title: The Cell
programme.desc: In this science fiction thriller, child psychiatrist Catherine Deane (Jennifer Lopez) has developed a technique that allows her to travel through the minds of her patients. When Stargher (Vincent D'Onofrio), a multiple murderer who methodically drowns his victims and performs bizarre rituals with their bodies, falls into a coma, FBI agent Peter Novak (Vince Vaughn) asks Deane to enter the killer's psyche, in the hope of finding a missing girl whom Stargher has kidnapped; if she's not soon found, in all likelihood she'll die in his torture cell. However, once Deane enters the bizarre world of Stargher's mind, she finds getting out to be a very difficult matter. The Cell was the first feature from director Tarsem, who previously made award-winning commercials and music videos, including the video for R.E.M.'s "Losing My Religion." The supporting cast includes Catherine Sutherland, Marianne Jean-Baptiste, Dylan Baker, and Pruitt Taylor Vince(n)

programme.title: Vice
programme.desc: A World in Disarray. An examination of the past, present and future of U.S. foreign policy and how post-Cold War alliances have shifted features conversations with diplomats, politicians and scholars, including Council on Foreign Relations president Richard Haass; former secretary of state Condoleezza Rice; former British prime minister Tony Blair; former UN ambassador Samantha Power; political scientist Francis Fukayama; and Sen. Chris Murphy (D-Conn.)(n)

programme.title: Born on the Fourth of July
programme.desc: The true story of Ron Kovic, a patriotic, All-American small town athlete who shocks his family by enlisting with the Marines to fight in the Vietnam War. Once he is overseas, however, Kovic's gung-ho enthusiasm turns to horror and confusion when he accidentally kills one of his own men in a firefight. His downfall is furthered by a bullet wound that leaves him paralyzed from the chest down(n)

programme.title: Every Brilliant Thing

programme.title: Mr. Woodcock
programme.desc: A successful self-help author comes home for a visit, only to find his mother engaged to his sadistic former gym teacher. Billy Bob Thornton, Susan Sarandon and Seann William Scott star in this outrageous farce. Directed by Craig Gillespie(n)

programme.title: Thirteen
programme.desc: Prolific production designer and art director Catherine Hardwicke makes her directorial debut with the coming-of-age drama Thirteen. Los Angeles teenager and overachiever Tracy (Evan Rachel Wood) is an excellent student in her seventh grade class and gets along well with her mother, Melanie (Holly Hunter). She fears that she's not cool enough to be friends with Evie (Nikki Reed), the most popular girl in school. Fueled with genuine adolescent energy, Tracy follows Evie's lead into the harsh realities of sex, drugs, and hard-edged adventure. Consumed with temptations and conflicting desires, Tracy loses her good-girl identity, greatly affecting her relationship with her mom. Partly autobiographical, Thirteen was co-written by Hardwicke and actual 13-year-old Reed, who are close family friends. Originally intending to write a teen comedy, they ended up creating a hard-hitting drama exposing the contemporary teenage experience. Thirteen was nominated for the Grand Jury Prize at the 2003 Sundance Film Festival, with Catherine Hardwicke taking home the Director's Award(n)

programme.title: Vice
programme.desc: A World in Disarray. An examination of the past, present and future of U.S. foreign policy and how post-Cold War alliances have shifted features conversations with diplomats, politicians and scholars, including Council on Foreign Relations president Richard Haass; former secretary of state Condoleezza Rice; former British prime minister Tony Blair; former UN ambassador Samantha Power; political scientist Francis Fukayama; and Sen. Chris Murphy (D-Conn.)(n)

programme.title: Born on the Fourth of July
programme.desc: The true story of Ron Kovic, a patriotic, All-American small town athlete who shocks his family by enlisting with the Marines to fight in the Vietnam War. Once he is overseas, however, Kovic's gung-ho enthusiasm turns to horror and confusion when he accidentally kills one of his own men in a firefight. His downfall is furthered by a bullet wound that leaves him paralyzed from the chest down(n)

programme.title: Thirteen
programme.desc: Prolific production designer and art director Catherine Hardwicke makes her directorial debut with the coming-of-age drama Thirteen. Los Angeles teenager and overachiever Tracy (Evan Rachel Wood) is an excellent student in her seventh grade class and gets along well with her mother, Melanie (Holly Hunter). She fears that she's not cool enough to be friends with Evie (Nikki Reed), the most popular girl in school. Fueled with genuine adolescent energy, Tracy follows Evie's lead into the harsh realities of sex, drugs, and hard-edged adventure. Consumed with temptations and conflicting desires, Tracy loses her good-girl identity, greatly affecting her relationship with her mom. Partly autobiographical, Thirteen was co-written by Hardwicke and actual 13-year-old Reed, who are close family friends. Originally intending to write a teen comedy, they ended up creating a hard-hitting drama exposing the contemporary teenage experience. Thirteen was nominated for the Grand Jury Prize at the 2003 Sundance Film Festival, with Catherine Hardwicke taking home the Director's Award(n)

programme.title: Martin Lawrence Live: Runteldat
programme.desc: Martin Lawrence is one of America's top black comedians, spoken of in the same breath as the late Richard Pryor and Eddie Murphy when they were at the height of their stand-up powers, and he's also appeared in films including Big Momma's House and Bad Boys. But he's also suffered setbacks in his personal life, from being arrested with a loaded gun at an airport to being accused by his co-star in the TV show Martin of sexual harassment. In this outstanding film of his stand-up routine, he confronts his demons and those who demonise him, as well as veering off to his favourite subject: women, and how hard they are to live with. And 'rundletat' is short for 'run and tell that'(n)

programme.title: Inkheart
programme.desc: Iain Softley's CGI fantasy adventure about a man with an extraordinary talent - and the consequences of his using it - stars Brendan Fraser, Paul Bettany and Andy Serkis. Mo Folchart is a 'silvertongue' - someone who possesses the ability to summon forth characters from the pages of novels and bring them into physical being in the real world. But it's a gift he does his best to hide from the rest of us, because there's a terrible price to be paid: each time a fictional character is brought to life, the vacuum created within the written work must be filled by a real-life person. And this is how his wife Resa came to vanish, after he manifested three ne'er-do-wells from a story. At first he refuses to help one of them, Dustfinger. But then Dustfinger teams up with the rather more focused criminal Capricorn, who has plans to force Mo to use his talents to provide him with gargantuan wealth and power. Thus Mo and his daughter Meggie are left little choice but to set out to thwart the villains' intentions - and rescue their loved ones from literary purgatory(n)

programme.title: Disney's The Kid
programme.desc: If you could talk to the child that you used to be, what advice would you give him? That question forms the basis of this comic fantasy. Forty-year-old Russ Duritz (Bruce Willis) is a wealthy and powerful "image consultant" who has made a career out of telling people how to present themselves. But while he's a success in business, he's a failure in life; he's vain, mean-spirited, and hasn't been able to hold onto a marriage (or even a pet dog). One day, Russ is startled to meet Rusty (Spencer Breslin), a stocky kid whom he soon realizes is himself at the age of eight, having passed through a wrinkle in time. Young Rusty doesn't seem much happier than the grown-up Russ, so the older man takes his younger self under his wing and tries to teach him how to avoid the mistakes he's made, while Rusty encourages Russ to be a more caring human being. Along the way, Russ and Rusty become friends, and realize how much they can learn from each other. Disney's The Kid also stars Jean Smart as one of Russ' clients, Lily Tomlin as his assistant, and Daniel Von Bargen as his father(n)

programme.title: Civil Brand
programme.desc: Television director Neema Barnette directs the forceful drama Civil Brand, based on a story by Preston A. Whitmore II. Shot with a micro-budget of 500,000 dollars, the film stars confrontational rap and hip-hop artists Mos Def, MC Lyte, and Da Brat. The story concerns a women's prison that exploits its largely African-American inmate population as cheap labor to manufacture products for a corporation. Mostly incarcerated due to domestic violence situations, the inmates also face sexual abuse as the hands of the prison staff, headed by Captain Deese (Clifton Powell) and Warden Nelson (Reed McCants). Accused of murder, Frances Shepard (Lisa Rae) joins forces with inmates Little Momma (Lark Voorhies), Wet (Monica Calhoun), and Nikki Barnes (N'Bushe Wright), as well as law student Michael (Mos Def), in order to start an uprising(n)

programme.title: Airheads

programme.desc: In this fantasy thriller, a man is given an unusual opportunity to change the past and alter his future. A man (James Caviezel), whose father (Dennis Quaid) died 30 years ago when he was just a boy, makes a startling discovery when working with his ham radio one night: he can speak with his late father over the radio. Having inadvertently found a way to reach into the past, the man desperately struggles to warn his father of the dangers that will come his way, in hopes of changing his tragic fate. Frequency also stars Andre Braugher, Elizabeth Mitchell, and Shawn Doyle(n)

programme.title: Michael
programme.desc: Two journalists, along with a self-proclaimed 'angel expert' are sent to Iowa to investigate a claim that an angel is living in a motel. They arrive to find the claim is true, but angel Michael is nothing like they expected. He smokes, drinks and loves the ladies. He agrees to travel to Chicago with the journalists, a decision that changes all their lives(n)

programme.title: Sister Act
programme.desc: Whoopi Goldberg stars in Emile Ardolino's comedy thriller as Deloris Van Cartier, a lounge singer at a casino managed by her lover VInce LaRocca. He's also a drugs baron and when she accidentally interrupts him in the process of rubbing out a stool pigeon, she has to run for her life. To keep her safe until LaRocca can be charged, the police arrange for her to become Sister Mary Clarence at a nunnery overseen by stern Mother Superior. But you can't keep a good singer down and Sister Mary has soon so successfully invigorated the choir with her musical talent that the church is packed - and there is even a call from Rome for a Papal performance. Unfortunately, thanks to an inside man in the police department, LaRocca learns of her whereabouts and sets out to prevent her testifying; can her new found friends, the nuns, protect her?(n)

programme.desc: Donna's Story. Donna denies her short story is really about herself and Eric---who's cast in a bad light; Red clashes with Bob's new lady friend (Mo Gaffney). Bob: Don Stark. Donna: Laura Prepon. Red: Kurtwood Smith(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: The Forgotten Son. Eric's doubly depressed: Red picks Kelso to star in his company training film about Eric's job; and Donna and Kitty are new fast friends(n)

programme.title: House on Haunted Hill
programme.desc: Remake of the 1950s horror in which a millionaire offers a million pounds to anyone who can spend a night in a creepy mansion that was once an asylum for the insane. When a group takes up his offer, they are unaware that their rich benefactor has rigged the house so he can have some fun for his money. However, he is unprepared for the possibility that the house might really be haunted(n)

programme.title: Haunter
programme.desc: A teenager and her family seem doomed to repeat the same day over and over again. Can she unlock the mystery?(n)

programme.title: Red Dragon
programme.desc: After the successful The Silence of the Lambs and Hannibal, Anthony Hopkins once again plays the perverse, cunning killer Hannibal Lecter in this prequel based on the homonymous book by Thomas Harris. Will Graham (Edward Norton) is an FBI investigator, an expert in analizing the minds and procedures of serial killers. After the dangerous arrest of Dr. Hannibal Lecter (Hopkins), Graham decides to end his career as a federal agent to retire and rest in Florida with his wife Molly (Mary-Louise Parker) and their son. However, the sudden appearance of a sadistic murderer known as Tooth Fairy (Ralph Fiennes), leads the investigator to be summoned again by his mentor, Jack Crawford (Harvey Keitel) to catch the criminal. Due to the extreme complexity of the case, Graham goes to Lecter himself for help. Trusting this sinister murderer does not seem to be quite the right thing to do, determined as he is to toy with the fate of the agent and his family. Emily Watson rounds off the multi-star cast of this distressing psychological thriller directed by Brett Ratner, who masterfully applied the exact doses of suspense and horror to the story(n)

programme.title: Fargo
programme.desc: Big Brother's Anna Nolan introduces her second pic of the night. The Coen Brothers multi-award-winning film (two Oscars, best director at Cannes, five BAFTAs) stars Frances McDormand as the heavily pregnant, slow-speaking but quick-witted Chief of Police of a small Minnesotan town who suddenly finds she has three murders on her hands as kidnappers Steve Buscemi and Peter Stormare happen to pass through(n)

programme.title: Predator
programme.desc: Dutch (Arnold Schwarzenegger) is the head of a specialized military rescue team in this science fiction action feature. He is sent to South America where he meets with his CIA friend Dillon (Carl Weathers), and the two combine forces to rescue some stranded American soldiers. The hunters become the hunted when an outer-space alien killer known as the Predator begins to kill the soldiers. Four special-effects artists were nominated for an Academy Award for their work in this feature(n)

programme.title: Dredd
programme.desc: A feared urban cop takes on a vicious city drug dealer in a futuristic metropolis as director Pete Travis (Vantage Point) and screenwriter Alex Garland (28 Days Later, Sunshine) team to bring iconic 2000A.D. lawman Judge Dredd to the big screen. In the future, much of North America has been poisoned by radiation. The sprawling urban jungle Mega City One stretches from Boston to Washington D.C., and in order to keep the growing criminal element in check, police enforcers called "Judges" have been given the power of judge, jury, and executioner. Judge Dredd (Karl Urban) is the most feared of them all, delivering death sentences with impunity as he fights to rid the streets of "Slo-Mo" -- a powerful new drug that alters its user's perception of time. In the process of training psychic rookie Cassandra Anderson (Olivia Thirlby), Dredd receives a report of an incident in a sprawling criminal stronghold ruled by fearsome drug lord Ma-Ma (Lena Headey), and ventures in to investigate. Upon learning that one of her top men has been captured by Dredd shortly thereafter, an enraged Ma-Ma seizes control of her massive 200-story complex, launching an all-out war against the Judges as Dredd and Cassandra find themselves trapped in the belly of the beast(n)

programme.title: Predator
programme.desc: Dutch (Arnold Schwarzenegger) is the head of a specialized military rescue team in this science fiction action feature. programme.title: Drive
programme.desc: In this intense thrill ride, a lone-wolf Hollywood stunt driver (Ryan Gosling) who moonlights as a getaway wheelman races to save his pretty neighbor and her young son after he angers L.A.'s most-feared criminal kingpin during a botched heist(n)

programme.title: Comedy Bang! Bang!
programme.sub-title: A$AP Rocky Wears a Black Button Up Jacket and Black Sneakers
programme.desc: A$AP Rocky Wears a Black Button Up Jacket and Black Sneakers. A$AP Rocky shows off his awards, while Scott unveils the trailer to his sports movie, and also watches as some of his personal paraphernalia comes to life(n)

programme.title: Portlandia
programme.desc: Pull-Out King. A 1980s punk awakens from a coma; a neglected email causes a stir; Nina shares surprising news with Lance; Malcolm and Kris throw a party at a live radio show; and Carrie goes on a date with a tax lawyer(n)

programme.title: Portlandia
programme.desc: Squiggleman. Concerned parents put together a band that plays music for children; and the Portland Nerd Council produces a public-service announcement. Meanwhile, a couple have an uneasy lunch at a vegan restaurant; and the Feminist Bookstore holds a comedy night(n)

programme.title: Pet Sematary
programme.desc: Upon moving to a quiet new neighbourhood, the Creed family lose their cat in a road accident. Feeling bad for them, a neighbour tells Mr Creed of an ancient Indian burial ground believed to have powers of resurrection. However, when the Creed's infant son meets a fate similar to the family pet, Mr Creed can't resist temptation and, in his zeal, unleashes an unspeakable evil from beyond the grave(n)

programme.title: Pet Sematary II
programme.desc: A liberal dose of humour is lumped in with the horror in this sequel to the 1989 hit based on Stephen King's novel. Edward Furlong is Geoff, the new kid in a small Maine town, whose veterinarian father has relocated after the death of his wife. After a friend's dog is killed, Geoff and the boy discover and make use of a 'sematary' with the power to reanimate the dead..(n)

programme.title: Fargo
programme.desc: Big Brother's Anna Nolan introduces her second pic of the night. The Coen Brothers multi-award-winning film (two Oscars, best director at Cannes, five BAFTAs) stars Frances McDormand as the heavily pregnant, slow-speaking but quick-witted Chief of Police of a small Minnesotan town who suddenly finds she has three murders on her hands as kidnappers Steve Buscemi and Peter Stormare happen to pass through(n)

programme.title: Silent Hill: Revelation 3D
programme.desc: In this visionary horror film, a teenager searches for her missing father in Silent Hill and encounters a world of nightmares as she races to rescue him from the dark forces that threaten them both(n)

programme.title: 28 Weeks Later
programme.desc: The US army flies in to reboot a destroyed London, but those still infected with the Rage Virus have other plans. Strong language/strong bloody violence/flashing images. (2007)(96 mins)(n)

programme.title: Carrie
programme.desc: Stephen King's best-selling novel gets a faithful, stylish telling here from Brian De Palma, in a story of a teenage girl who discovers she has the extraordinary ability to move objects by the power of her thoughts alone, which eventually leads to mayhem and horror at her high-school prom(n)

programme.title: Jeepers Creepers 2
programme.desc: After the runaway success of Jeepers Creepers in 2001, it was inevitable there would be a sequel, but this is just as smart and scary as the original. The Creeper has just two days of his allotted 23 on earth left to both eat his fill and replenish body parts that have decayed during his enforced years of hibernation. Fortunately, a broken-down bus full of college basketball players and their cheerleaders should provide for his needs. As the students are picked off one by one, their only hope is local farmer Jack Taggart, who's out to avenge his son's death. Victor Salva's film is satisfyingly full of edge-of-the-seat moments, not to mention the required quota of gruesome deaths and gore(n)

programme.title: Shutter Island
programme.desc: Martin Scorsese and Leonardo DiCaprio team up for a fourth time for this adaptation of Shutter Island, a novel by Dennis Lehane (Mystic River). The film opens in 1954 as World War II veteran and current federal marshal Teddy Daniels (Leonardo DiCaprio) and his new partner, Chuck (Mark Ruffalo), ferry to Shutter Island, a water-bound mental hospital housing the criminally insane. They have been asked to investigate the disappearance of Rachel Solando (Emily Mortimer), a patient admitted to the asylum after she murdered her three children. As Teddy quizzes Dr. Cawley (Ben Kingsley), the head of the institution, he begins to suspect that the authorities in charge might not be giving him the whole truth, and that a terrible fate may befall all the patients in the spooky Ward C -- a unit devoted to the most heinous of the hospital's inmates. Complicating matters further, Teddy has a secret of his own -- the arsonist who murdered his wife is incarcerated on Shutter Island. Driven to confront his wife's killer, and stranded on the island because of a hurricane, Teddy must unravel the secrets of the eerie place before succumbing to his own madness. Max von Sydow, Emily Mortimer, Michelle Williams, Patricia Clarkson, and Jackie Earle Haley round out the supporting cast(n)

programme.desc: The chef visits the region of Jura, where a local farmer shows him around his orchards and teaches him about the region's apples and pears, which James uses as the accompaniment in a barbecued duck. He also visits Fort des Rousses, the old military stronghold that is now used for the making of Comte, one of the country's most popular cheeses.(n)

programme.title: Inside London Fire Brigade
programme.desc: Fifty-year-old crew manager Aldo is about to retire, but not before he hands over the baton to 25-year-old rookie Joe, who is put to the test fighting his first fire. Brixton firefighter Josie uses a thermal camera to locate the flames in a top-floor flat filling with smoke, Tami is called to an incident on Westminster Bridge, and Neil and Barry from the Fire Investigation Team attend the aftermath of a disaster where the homeowner failed to get out alive. It's their job to piece together what happened. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Schofield's South African Adventure
programme.desc: Phillip Schofield and wife Steph go shopping in Cape Town's Greenmarket Square, before he rides the cable car to the top of South Africa's Table Mountain and reveals the secrets of the wildlife that lives at the top. From the summit, Phillip views Robben Island, where Nelson Mandela was incarcerated and shares the inspiration that the anti-apartheid revolutionary's hope alive. He then plays daredevil by heading down the mountain via the world's highest commercial abseil, before tasting the wine at Groot Constantia, South Africa's oldest vineyard.(n)

programme.title: Lion Country: Night and Day
programme.desc: Tensions between the two prides build when their territories begin to overlap. programme.desc: Former EastEnders bad girl Charlie Brooks (Janine) and retired England rugby union player Ben Cohen (Strictly Come Dancing) tackle a series of fiendishly difficult challenges testing skill, dexterity, reaction, wit and wisdom. Cheered by on friends and family in the studio, they're under intense pressure to hold their nerve and avoid slip-ups inside The Cube as they aim for the £250,000 charity jackpot. Each given nine lives at the start, the contestants can also use `simplify' and 'trial run' lifelines to make the job a little easier. Phillip Schofield is the host.(n)

programme.desc: Eddie Redmayne talks about his role in Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them. Illusionist and former Britain's Got Talent semi-finalist James More also performs.(n)

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Jacob's loyalty lands him in trouble, Leyla is puzzled, and stubborn Lawrence stands his ground.(n)

programme.desc: Megan is touched by Frank's claims to have changed his ways as he outlines his plans for the future. However, Charity sees them together and warns her that they need to stick to the plan. Jacob has an important decision to make, and Lawrence feels chastened.(n)

programme.title: Two and a Half Men
programme.desc: Alan's love life begins to improve with the help of his brother's Mercedes, while Charlie is forced to cover for Jake after he disappears with a former NFL player's daughter. Starring Jon Cryer, Charlie Sheen and Angus T Jones.(n)

programme.title: Two and a Half Men
programme.sub-title: He Smelled the Ham, He Got Excited.
programme.desc: Alan thinks about retiring when Evelyn announces she will take care of Jake's college education, but the youngster displays a talent that could change their plans for him.(n)

programme.desc: Drinking buddies Phil and Stu try to help their troubled friend Alan get his life in order, only to stumble into another bizarre misadventure. The Mob have taken Alan's brother hostage and to free him, they have to track down manic gangster Mr Chow, who has escaped from a Thai prison. Comedy sequel, starring Bradley Cooper, Ed Helms, Zach Galifianakis and John Goodman.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Part two of two. As the blackout continues, Peter presses on with his Star Wars-inspired tale, with his friends and family replacing the cast of the space opera in a modified version of Episode IV: A New Hope.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: The principal of the local school tries to improve test scores by expelling its worst pupils, and Lois is outraged when Chris is the first student to get the chop. programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: First of a two-part storyline. Jenny's life starts to spiral out of control and begins to affect her work, leaving Dennis and Liz facing difficult decisions. New doctor Helen Trent arrives in Aidensfield with her wealthy husband Matt, hoping to make a fresh start, but finds it hard to adjust to the slow pace of life in the country. Sophie Ward joins the regular cast, including Sarah Tansey, Duncan Bell and Aislin McGuckin.(n)

programme.title: Where the Heart Is

Unfortunately, Pop puts all his finances into bidding for a stately home, casting a shadow over her extravagant plans for the wedding. Rural drama, starring David Jason, Pam Ferris and Catherine Zeta-Jones.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Conclusion of a two-part storyline. A kidnap case leaves Vernon's plans for Liz and Ben's wedding in chaos, while Helen's dreams of a fresh start for her and Matt look set to be shattered. Jenny is relieved when she finally gets a medical diagnosis explaining her recent symptoms, but the news brings a difficult decision for husband Dennis, who has to choose between his wife and his police career. Starring newcomer Sophie Ward, Oliver Montgomery, Duncan Bell and Sarah Tansey.(n)

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Suspicion falls on Adam over missing hospital funds and Mike attends a meeting to assess the mental welfare of a 50-year-old man (guest Andrew Dunn) who still lives with his mother. Elsewhere, Gordon's former father-in-law pays an unexpected visit with sobering news and Ken makes a confession to his colleagues. Guest starring Michael Jayston.(n)

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: When the Green Woods Laugh - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. Pop can barely contain his glee as his beloved Mariette's wedding draws closer, until a summons from the magistrate threatens to turn it into a far from `perfick' day. Whimsical drama, starring David Jason, Pam Ferris and Catherine Zeta-Jones.(n)

programme.title: You're Only Young Twice
programme.desc: Cissie shocks the other ladies with her behaviour after returning from a funeral.(n)

programme.desc: A flu epidemic hits the depot, improving Stan's financial health as he and Jack clock up overtime. Vintage comedy, starring Reg Varney.(n)

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: The leader of a censorship campaign comes to Oxford on a speaking tour, and Morse is charged with protecting her in light of a series of death threats. A bricklayer working on a controversial pop singer's house is later found dead, and when a second killing occurs, a connection emerges to the speaker's movement, plunging Morse into the middle of a conflict over the nature of British culture.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Brooks and Devlin investigate when former top-flight footballer Robbie Nichols is murdered in the East End of London, in what appears to be a robbery gone wrong. They question a man seen in the area on the night of the killing, who protests his innocence and points the finger at a known gangster he claims was also at the scene. With the detectives at odds over who to believe, Steel finds it increasingly difficult to prosecute the accused. Bradley Walsh, Jamie Bamber and Ben Daniels star.(n)

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: Part one of two. A killer starts dumping the bodies of homeless men in the financial district of Bradfield, leaving little for Tony to work on except the bizarre ritualistic nature of the crimes. Oxbridge graduate DI Andy Hall fills in for Alex when she suffers a family bereavement and Kevin moves into Tony's flat to offer police protection when it becomes clear a stalker has the clinical psychologist in his or her sights. Drama, starring Robson Green, with Mark Letheren and John Hopkins.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Biggs
programme.desc: Charmian struggles to provide for the family as Ronnie continues to languish in prison, and embarks on an affair with a young sailor - but the fling has unexpected consequences and forces her to make a devastating decision. A glimmer of hope emerges when she discovers Ronnie is planning to escape, but the police are turning up the pressure on his criminal colleagues. Drama, starring Sheridan Smith.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Veteran singer and keyboard player Alan Price guest stars in this festive episode of the rural drama, as the leader of a jazz band. Travelling to Aidensfield, where they've been booked by Vernon to play at the villagers' Christmas concert, the Rio Trio offer a lift to a girl, unaware she is a single mum taking her baby home to see her parents for the holiday. However, the first the band know about the infant is when the girl disappears, leaving them to look after it. Meanwhile, as the concert gets into full swing, local barmaid Gina takes centre stage, hoping to impress all and sundry with her rendition of Winter Wonderland. Tricia Penrose, Derek Fowlds, Geoffrey Hughes, William Simons and Mark Jordon star.(n)

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Jill becomes unwell after receiving the results of a pregnancy test. Elsewhere, when a baby goes missing, suspicion falls on the parents of a girl admitted with a broken ankle. Meanwhile, Gordon makes a discovery about a diabetic patient that explains his behaviour and, in a dramatic finale, tragedy looms. Daniel Casey guest stars.(n)

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: A Breath of French Air - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. Dispirited by a wet English summer, the Larkins cross the Channel in the hope that the French way of life will have a beneficial effect on the family. David Jason, Pam Ferris and Catherine Zeta-Jones star.(n)

programme.title: You're Only Young Twice
programme.desc: Flora upsets ex-theatrical trouper Dolly Love whose one and only film is shown on television. However, Dolly gets the last laugh after a letter turns up with a role in a TV commercial for her. Unfortunately, she is considered too glamorous for the part, leaving it open to someone else. Comedy, starring Peggy Mount and Pat Coombs.(n)

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: The new depot nurse moves in as the Butlers' lodger - causing problems for Arthur. Vintage comedy, starring Reg Varney and Michael Robbins.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: An intense competition between two rival yacht captains ends in murder - so Jessica tries to apprehend the culprit. Angela Lansbury stars.(n)

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: After reaching breaking point with being followed around by Buddy, Martin resolves to find a vet to have it put down, while Ruth finds out that Bert has been trying to make his own whisky. Clive is suspicious of Mrs Tishell and who she might be cooking meals for, Penhale makes a hash of asking Janice out, and Louisa and Martin's therapy homework results in a picnic on the beach, where they are interrupted by local vet Angela Sim - who appears to be hallucinating. Comedy drama, guest starring Caroline Quentin.(n)

programme.title: The Street
programme.desc: Anna Friel plays a single mother who turns to prostitution to pay her debts and provide for her sons' schooling. Things seem to be going well, and when her boiler breaks, romance beckons with the arrival of a handsome plumber. However, her life turns sour when his father recognises her and warns her off his son and grand-daughter, just as she is beginning to fall in love. Also starring David Bradley and Daniel Mays.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: High-court judge Rachel Callaghan (guest star Juliet Stevenson) is critically injured after being shot in the underground car park of her apartment. When it becomes clear a hitman was responsible, the team tries to discover who hired him. As evidence mounts against the accused, the judge's health deteriorates, and Castle is faced with a choice between friendship and respect for a person's right to die. Bill Paterson, Bradley Walsh and Freema Agyeman star.(n)

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: Part two of two. Tony decodes the meaning of the ritual killings of homeless men and realises a clue to the murderer's identity has been under his nose all the time. Aware everyone has the potential to become a killer, he fails to foresee the threat to his own life from the mysterious stalker. Drama, starring Robson Green, with Simone Lahbib and Mark Letheren.(n)

programme.desc: A sudden staffing crisis leaves Arthur with no choice but to employ his nephew Ray to help him sell cut-price cars from Brussels - his idea of entering the European market. Drama, starring George Cole and Gary Webster.(n)

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: Bodie and Doyle are trained to act as bodyguards to a Middle Eastern president who is preparing to sign an important peace treaty. Meanwhile, two killers are receiving similar training to prepare them to assassinate him. As their paths cross, the CI5 operatives learn the would-be killers have some useful inside information and share more in common with them than they may have imagined.(n)

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: I'd Do Anything for Lesa (But I Won't Do That).
programme.desc: Lesa and Jerry get into a heated argument on their return from the east of the state, and Victor finds himself rushing to the local fire department.(n)

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers attend fiercely competitive auctions in Garland, where Moe and Mary find a rare historical artefact and Jenny discovers items that may stretch her sensibilities. Ricky and Bubba leave their comfort zone to turn a Texas river into a trading post.(n)

programme.title: World Series of Darts: Auckland
programme.desc: Stephen McIvor presents action from day one featuring the first-round matches, as eight seeded PDC players faced Oceanic qualifiers at the Trusts Arena in New Zealand. With commentary by Stuart Pyke, Rod Harrington and Glen Larmer.(n)

programme.title: Rambo: First Blood Part II
programme.desc: Incarcerated Special Forces veteran John Rambo is offered the chance for freedom by former commander Colonel Trautman if he takes up the offer to return to the jungles of Vietnam on a life-or-death mission to rescue American PoWs. During the course of the operation, he develops strong feelings for his guide, a female freedom fighter - but tragedy strikes, leaving him more determined than ever to exact a bloody and explosive revenge. Action adventure sequel, starring Sylvester Stallone, Richard Crenna, Julia Nickson-Soul, Steven Berkoff, George Kee Cheung, Andy Wood and Martin Kove.(n)

programme.title: Monsignor Renard
programme.desc: Madeleine reluctantly begins re-examining her attitude to the Germans and Renard is arrested for an act of resistance, forcing him into a battle of wills with the secret police. Wartime drama, starring John Thaw and Cheryl Campbell.(n)

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: A brother and sister stand accused of murdering their father and stepmother, and pleading for them proves to be the most complex assignment of Kavanagh's entire career. Legal drama, starring John Thaw, Anna Chancellor and Art Malik.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Edward returns home, but his experiences in the trenches have led to shell shock and he collapses during the New Year celebrations, while Hazel is saddened to learn that James will be delayed.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone

Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw and Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat

Starring John Thaw, with John Wood, Richard Pasco, Lisa Harrow and Nicholas Jones.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Lady Prudence's society friends are rehearsing their show at Bellamy House when an air raid warning sounds, forcing everyone to shelter underground. As Richard surveys his damaged property the next day, a telegram arrives with chilling news about James.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: A coach crash on the M62 causes chaos for the staff as A&E is overrun with patients needing treatment, while Sam is shocked to find her badly beaten brother waiting at reception. Elsewhere, new doctor Danny has a baptism of fire when he informs the wrong family of a patient's death - and later gets held up at gunpoint, along with Robert, by a man seeking revenge for the death of his son. Starring Martin Shaw and James Murray.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The detective sets out for Norfolk when a country publican begs him to help solve a murder - but is disappointed when the innkeeper turns out to be a budding author and the killing fictional. However, he soon has food for thought when a real death occurs - committed by a seemingly ghostly hand. Geraldine Alexander and Ian McCulloch guest star, with David Suchet.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.sub-title: The Affair at the Victory Ball.
programme.desc: The sleuth is invited to attend a masquerade ball dressed as someone famous and modestly goes as himself - and finds time amid the revelry to solve the murder of aristocratic fellow guest Lord Cronshaw. David Suchet stars.(n)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Janet voices her concerns to Dodson about Gill's drinking, hoping it can be dealt with amicably, so she's unnerved when her observations are taken more seriously than she intended. Meanwhile, just as Rachel feels like she's getting to grips with the sergeant's job, she makes a fatal error that puts Janet and Chris in danger. The body of a man who disappeared 15 years previously is found on the moors. Inquiries lead to a nearby farm, where the detectives encounter something much more sinister than they could have anticipated.(n)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: The discovery of slaves on the Pritchard farm has turned a murder inquiry into a multi-agency operation. The enormity of the case brings Dodson to Syndicate 9, keen to establish Gill's state of mind and efficacy as senior officer. Having been the driver involved in the fatal collision with Cal Pritchard, Janet is under investigation and unable to interview the man's widow Evie. Devastated by the consequences of her actions, the detective eventually finds solace in Chris's calm and kind reasoning, but when an incandescent Evie smells alcohol on Gill's breath, she has all the ammunition she needs to discredit the case and bring the DCI down.(n)

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: The return of the detective drama set in the 1950s, starring James Norton and Robson Green. Sidney receives a series of anonymous phone calls, which he realises may be linked to a series of murders in which the victims were all important community figures killed by someone who leaves dead birds as a grisly calling card. The threat forces Sidney to question whether he can reconcile his relationship with Amanda and his calling as a vicar. Leonard bonds with Hilary as she cares for her dying father, while Geordie's investigation of the killings leads him to a mysterious home for people with disabilities.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.sub-title: The Theft of the Royal Ruby.

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: David Suchet takes on his final case as the Belgian sleuth in the last-ever episode of the long-running drama. Crippled with arthritis, Poirot is now using a wheelchair and has a life-threatening heart condition, but remains as sharp as ever. Calling on old friend Captain Hastings for assistance, he returns to Styles, where the pair first met 30 years earlier on a murder investigation. The detective is convinced the country house is once again harbouring a killer, and as guests fall victim to a mysterious attacker, he must summon the last of his strength to battle his ultimate nemesis. With Hugh Fraser, Anne Reid, Philip Glenister, Helen Baxendale, Matthew McNulty, Anna Madeley and Shaun Dingwall.(n)

programme.title: DCI Banks
programme.desc: Conclusion. However, an unexpected turn of events pushes the grizzled DCI and his team back to square one, and Banks comes to understand a one-on-one confrontation may be his only chance to bring down Richards. programme.title: The Sixth Sense
programme.desc: (1999) M Night Shyamalan's chiller about a boy who has the not-entirely-welcome ability to directly contact the dead. Bruce Willis stars as child psychologist Dr Malcolm Crowe, who is asked to help Cole Sear (Haley Joel Osment), who claims he can 'see dead people'. Crowe is sceptical at first, but - prompted partly by a past case he felt he badly let down - he's gradually convinced that the boy is telling the truth. Crowe believes that actively engaging with the ghostly presences could help both Sear and the spirits to find peace. Overcoming his terror, the lad finds that communicating with the deceased does, at first, seem to be beneficial. But then matters take on their own momentum, leading to one of the director's trademark plot twists... Also starring Toni Collette. M,W,S,(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps Nicholas and Pauline Patch, a couple who have frequently holidayed on Fuerteventura in the Canary Islands and are now looking for a second home there. Armed with a budget of £125,000, she shows them around a range of potential properties.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps Chris James and Susan Spencer from Norfolk find their dream waterfront holiday home in Tampa, Florida. The couple have a budget of £150,000, and are hoping to find a place their entire family will enjoy.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to Tower View Hotel, in Blackpool, where owner Jennifer McGirr is joined by friend Diana Carnegie. Daniel Walker and George Gillespie find some unwanted guests in the bathroom and trouble arises at breakfast when some of the guests try ordering off-menu.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners visit Church Spa in East Markham in Nottinghamshire on their second evening, where proprietor Daniel Walker and family friend George Gillespie hope to wow their guests with their relaxing facilities. Steve and Lisa Tindall seem impressed, but Jennifer and Diana Carnegie question the high price tag.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third hosts of the week are Steve and Lisa Tindall, who own the King's Head Inn in Rye, East Sussex, where they hope their guests will fall for their boutique B&B. They get into the swing of things with a round of blindfolded mini-golf, but not everyone gets a solid night's sleep afterwards.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Former breakfast TV presenter Matt Arnold welcomes the contestants to The Bridge Hotel Brandon in Suffolk, and hopes that his mantra of `beautiful beds, blissful bathrooms and brilliant breakfasts' shines through. The group takes part in a rowing competition in the afternoon, but delays at breakfast and a runny egg cause irritation.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The hoteliers get together one last time to confront their rivals, defend any criticism and find out what they have been paid. However, things get particularly heated when it's time to count up the cash.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps prospective buyers Leslie and Helen Hodgkins from Halifax, West Yorkshire, find a second home in Lanzarote with a budget of £150,000.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin travels to Cape Coral in Florida, where he tries to help Tim Morris and his partner Elaine find their dream waterfront property on a budget of £300,000.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team of archaeologists investigate the lost Roman town of Cunetio, which lies buried under wheat fields in Wiltshire. The project is particularly close to Phil Harding's heart, as in the 1970s he helped verify a find of 55,000 Roman coins on the site. The scale of the team's task, along with the inclement weather, makes the dig even more challenging - but the discoveries prove to be worth the effort.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Something for the Weekend: Tregruk Castle.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the archaeologists travel to Monmouthshire, where they investigate Tregruk - formerly one of Britain's biggest castles. After setting out to examine the interior to find out how the structure fitted into a network of fortresses built by English barons 700 years ago, the team members dig deeper into the trenches - and realise they have uncovered a medieval Xanadu.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: Darren and Pam bring their new bulldog puppy in to Scott Miller's clinic for a vaccination, but they are crushed to discover that it needs an operation for an eye defect.(n)

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: The architect meets a couple who have remortgaged their house to build a prototype apartment inspired by a beehive, and a man planning to convert an old car into a cocktail bar. He also visits a UFO-like build at a tree hotel in a Swedish forest and a unique one-bedroom home created behind the facade of a garage.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud revisits Andy and Nicky Bruce who were building an experimental amphibious house on a small island on the Thames in Buckinghamshire. They spent £1.2 million on one of the most ambitious Grand Designs ever, but the logistical headache of building on an island only accessible by a narrow footbridge soon became clear. Heavy machinery was swept away by the river, contractors were changed, and the site was hit by severe storms, causing delays and resulting in an unfinished and untested building. Kevin returns to find out what living on a regularly flooded piece of land is like, and whether the floating home performed when the river burst its banks in January 2015.(n)

programme.title: Outlander
programme.desc: Claire and Jamie are thrown together in marriage, and as their emotional and physical relationship develops, deeper feelings arise between the pair - and the nurse becomes torn between two men in very different times.(n)

programme.title: Princess Diana's Dresses: The Auction
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the stories behind some of Diana, Princess of Wales's most memorable outfits - a collection of couture dresses that was put up for auction in March 2013 at the biggest-ever UK sale of her clothes. From the 25ft train of her wedding gown to the midnight blue off-the-shoulder creation she wore while famously dancing with John Travolta in 1985, the programme provides an insight into how Diana used her wardrobe to express her individuality and asks what motivated her fashion decisions.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the words-and-numbers quiz. 8 Out of 10 Cats team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson are joined by guests Rhod Gilbert, Kevin Bridges and Josie Long in this edition. Countdown regular Susie Dent is in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley does the maths - with a little help from comedian Joe Wilkinson.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads for Bridgeport, Connecticut, to visit Cafe Tavolini, which is being neglected by husband and wife managers teetering on the edge of divorce. The estranged couple's two children are struggling to save the business from their parents' disputes, and the visiting chef tries to shock the pair into stopping the restaurant from becoming a casualty of their quarrel.(n)

programme.title: Outlander
programme.desc: Claire and Jamie are thrown together in marriage, and as their emotional and physical relationship develops, deeper feelings arise between the pair - and the nurse becomes torn between two men in very different times.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud revisits Andy and Nicky Bruce who were building an experimental amphibious house on a small island on the Thames in Buckinghamshire. They spent £1.2 million on one of the most ambitious Grand Designs ever, but the logistical headache of building on an island only accessible by a narrow footbridge soon became clear. Heavy machinery was swept away by the river, contractors were changed, and the site was hit by severe storms, causing delays and resulting in an unfinished and untested building. Kevin returns to find out what living on a regularly flooded piece of land is like, and whether the floating home performed when the river burst its banks in January 2015.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps prospective buyers Leslie and Helen Hodgkins from Halifax, West Yorkshire, find a second home in Lanzarote with a budget of £150,000.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin travels to Cape Coral in Florida, where he tries to help Tim Morris and his partner Elaine find their dream waterfront property on a budget of £300,000.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to Wisteria House, Hampshire, where owner Jane Faulkner invites guests to her establishment. Later, the group members try their hands at milking a cow, while 25-year-old Zak causes surprises when he reveals his years of hospitality experience.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests visit The Living Room B&B in Bournemouth on their second night, which is co-owned by 25-year-old Zak Busby-Pelekanou. While at the establishment, Mike and Charlie have a hairy issue, and Jane and Amy encounter a spider, before getting to grips with an ambitious breakfast menu.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to the Valley Hotel in Anglesey, where owner Mike Lewis hopes his five-star pedigree will help him reap dividends in the competition. After a visit to a local RNLI station, guests Jane and Amy are left feeling sluggish when they spot an unwanted visitor in their room, and their criticism leaves the hosts looking for answers.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: David and Elvira Barratt welcome the contestants to Barratt's at Ty'n Rhyl, Denbighshire, but the group has an unpleasant experience on arrival. The guests take part in an activity at a local cookery school where they are taught the art of preparing and cooking sheep's testicles. However, come feedback time, the hosts are left feeling distraught.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners meet to find out who earned the most and have it out with their rivals. Jane and Amy kick off proceedings with a gripe over David and Elvira's coffee criticism, yet are confronted themselves by Zak, who has a score to settle. Mike and Charlie of the Valley Hotel want to get to the bottom of an unwanted intruder during their stay at Wisteria House, and the ladies are challenged again regarding their cleanliness comments. Emotions run high as the cash is counted and the winner is revealed.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: A couple disagree over where to spend their retirement, with husband Michael hoping to set up home in Derbyshire, where he will be able to indulge his passion for the British countryside. Conversely, his wife Susan would like to spend her time relaxing by a pool in the Spanish sun, and it is left up to Laura Hamilton and Jasmine Harman to help them decide where to spend their £180,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: A couple with very different ideas of how they want to spend their retirement seek advice from Jonnie Irwin and Jasmine Harman. While husband Tony plans on returning to the Wirral in Merseyside, his wife Karin hopes to move to southern Spain, where her sister has already settled.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team head to Governor's Green in Portsmouth, where they search for the site of a 13th-century hospital founded by monks. Although part of the building still stands, the whereabouts of the rest of it remain shrouded in mystery - and initial evidence from the trenches makes the task even more confusing, leading to a clash between the diggers and surveyors.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team visit the Oxfordshire town of Burford to respond to a challenge from Professor Mick Aston. Here, they investigate the remains of a medieval hospital in the grounds of Burford Priory, where Mick also found evidence of a lost Anglo-Saxon settlement. Over three days, the team hopes to unearth the history of both the hospital and the earlier Saxon community, and the subsequent discoveries look set to redraw the historical map of the area.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: Liza Tarbuck pops into the surgery with her elderly dog Wilf, and vet Scott Miller's Border terrier Betty has therapy on a water treadmill to help with rehabilitation after emergency spinal surgery.(n)

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: The architect meets a carpenter who wants to turn a 30-year-old double-decker bus into a luxury holiday retreat, and a couple using their life savings to design a boat hotel. He also visits a house in Oxford made from mud and straw, and builds a camping deck out of a motorway drainage pipe for his own tree-house project.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud returns to north Cornwall to see one of his favourite Grand Designs, and discover whether Rebecca Sturrock and Gregory Kewish have been successful with their ambitious plans. Their project, to reinforce the walls of an old bungalow and put a new living space on top made entirely of cross-laminated timber, soon ran into difficulties, but now fully complete both inside and out, Kevin finds out whether this innovative house is really big enough to accommodate a growing family.(n)

programme.title: Dicte - Crime Reporter
programme.desc: The official police investigation pins the blame for two murders on Wagner, but Dicte tries to assist him in working out who the real killer is. In Danish. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Sister Jen is on duty in resus looking after 48-year-old Bobby, who has been suffering from seizures at home. Bobby has spent most of his adult life in prison for a number of violent crimes including murder. Meanwhile, 70-year-old Ronald had to cut short his 46th wedding anniversary celebrations after experiencing breathing difficulties, and Rienelle, seven, receives treatment after falling from the top of a climbing frame at school.(n)

programme.title: Planet Carnivore
programme.desc: Lions. Ngorongoro Crater is lush, beautiful -- and rich with residents that graze its volcanic floor. Two thousand foot high cliffs surround the Crater floor, which is home to over 13,000 herd animals. The Crater is also home to a number of lions and hyenas - the highest density of large carnivores in Africa. At 18 years, Msaka is the Crater's oldest lioness. She's one of the founders and leaders of the Lakette Pride, the biggest lion pride in Ngorongoro. A large family means a lot of mouths to feed. Despite her experience, and the size of her pride, prey is still hard to catch. Lions miss their targets an average of four times out of five. Now, Msaka's chances just became worse. She has grown too old to take the lead in a hunt. She now relies on Kibibi, the pride's most promising young huntress, to help her and the other members. But Kibibi has been missing for days, and without her, Msaka's group of lionesses stands a slim chance of catching anything substantial. As the huntresses, lionesses need a lot of fuel - an average of twenty pounds of meat a day. Without it, their bodies quickly grow weak - and for an old lioness, weakness in the Crater could be a death sentence. As the week unfolds, the pride's difficulties with catching food continue. And -- just when it seems things can't get any worse, they do. Four nomadic male lions arrive at the borders of Lakette territory, preparing an attack that will claim the pride -- and its fertile lionesses. To reach the lionesses, the usurping males need to get through Moran. He is the Lakette pride's male, and he has guarded them successfully for five years. But, at the age of eight, he's showing his years and almost past his prime. Against the combined strength and determination of four strong, young lions, will Moran still be able to protect the pride? If he doesn't repel the challengers, it could mean bloodshed and disaster for the pride. New males usually kill the cubs of previous males -- so they can father their own. As the week comes to a close, the battle lines are drawn. As the invaders prepare their attack, the Lakette pride will have one chance to defend itself - and to surviveÉ(n)

programme.title: Brutal Killers
programme.desc: Dealing with rival males, successful lions need to be brutal and use any means in their power to quash would-be kings. These are not random acts of violence but vital behavior to secure their own genetic future. Once inside a pride as its protectors, the lions take their share in kills for which they have not worked. As sub-adult males in the pride grow, they are considered a threat. They must leave to find a pride of their own. As the years pass, the new would-be kings must take over a pride with an act of barbarity that's scarcely conceivable(n)

programme.title: The Last Lions
programme.desc: A resilient lioness in Botswana's Okavango Delta embarks on an epic journey of survival in this nature documentary from National Geographic and award-winning filmmakers Dereck and Beverly Joubert. Narrated by Academy Award winner Jeremy Irons, The Last Lions follows Ma di Tau ("Mother of Lions") as she races to get her cubs to safety during a rampaging fire, and fends off ferocious lioness Silver Eye, the murderous matriarch of a rival pride. Crossing crocodile-infested waters on a quest to reach Duba Island, the fiercely protective mother discovers that in order for her family to survive, she must conquer a herd of buffalos with piercing horns. Later, in an incredible turn of fate, Ma di Tau forges a fragile alliance with a rival pride in order to wage a desperate battle to preserve their bloodline in the face of certain extinction(n)

programme.desc: Hanna-Barbera's beloved picnic-basket-stealing bear makes his big-screen debut in this live-action/animation mix children's flick from Journey to the Center of the Earth director Eric Brevig. The tourists just aren't flocking to Jellystone Park like they used to, and when the budget starts to get tight, Mayor Brown (Andrew Daly) brings down the axe. But while the mayor can certainly make a quick buck by selling the land, what about the families who like to spend their summers in the great outdoors? When Yogi (Dan Aykroyd) and Boo-Boo (Justin Timberlake) discover they're about to become homeless, they realize that their only hope for keeping Jellystone open is to team up with their old enemy Ranger Smith (Tom Cavanagh) and wage wildlife warfare against greedy Mayor Brown(n)

programme.desc: Shanghaied; Gary Takes a Bath. Gary avoids getting a bath. After a failed attempt to "sail around and frighten people," and a close call with their captor's dinner plate, the trio are granted three wishes---two of which they immediately waste(n)

programme.title: Full House
programme.desc: Girls Will Be Boys. Now that her best friend Teddy (Tahj Mowry) has developed the traditional five-year-old's disdain for girls, Michelle (played by the Olsen twins) is worried that she will no longer be accepted by any of her male schoolmates. As a result, she re-invents herself as a tomboy, with the expected wacky results. Elsewhere, Joey (David Coulier) asks Jesse (John Stamos) to take charge of the music on his TV kiddie show; and DJ (Candace Cameron) attempts to scare Steph (Jodie Sweetin) out of her persistent nosiness(n)

programme.desc: Michael Harding explores the best walking and cycling tracks around the country, beginning by following the Miners' Way and Historical Trail from the town of Boyle, Roscommon, to his home in Arigna. Along with his guide, Philip James, the writer and storyteller visits Boyle Abbey - a 12th-century monastery, which was later converted into a military garrison in the 17th century. The pair's next point of interest is Rockingham House, followed by Moylurg Tower - a focal point of the Lough Key Forest and Activity Park. The final stretch of their journey is to the Arigna Mining Experience, where they meet former miner Peter McNiff.(n)
